revision.text:
When you hear the Country and Western singers yodel, do you wish you could do the same thing? Have you tried it, but it never sounded like a real, genuine yodel? The following steps might just help you to be the best yodeler on your block. [[Category:Singing]] == Steps == === Yodeling Basics === #Understand the break. The secret to yodeling is learning to find the break in your voice. All human voices have two distinct vocal registers; your normal or "chest" voice and your high or "head" voice. The break occurs at the point where your chest voice switches to your head voice. Yodeling is characterized by the jump from chest voice to head voice, while breaking your voice at the same time.

[[Image:Yodel Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] #Find your break. Don't worry - it's not painful! Pick a sound, such as "oh" and move your voice from low to high, listening for the break. The point at which the break occurs will be different for everybody.

[[Image:Yodel Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] #*If you're having trouble finding your break, trying howling like a wolf - seriously, it will help! #*Fun fact! The break is created by the epiglottis, a flap at the back of your tongue which prevents you from inhaling food while you eat. #Practice. Practice moving from low to high notes, making sure to emphasize the break. Start with any mid-range note in your chest, using the sound "oh". Now jump up to a high note in your head using the sound "ou".

[[Image:Yodel Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] #*Try not to tense up your voice, keep it relaxed. #*Don't let the notes slide smoothly - unlike other singing styles where singers try to move smoothly from one note to the next, the break between notes is essential for yodeling correctly. #Remember the knock knock joke. Knock knock. Who's there? Little old lady. Little-old-lady-WHO! Practice your yodel by singing "little-old-lady-WHO," with the jump from chest voice to head voice occurring between the word "lady" and the word "who". Go on, try it!

[[Image:Yodel Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] #Attempt a triad yodel. Most styles of yodeling are founded around three notes - the triad. Try singing the notes A, E, then D to form a triad yodel. The A should be sung in your chest voice, while the E and D notes should be sung in your head voice.

[[Image:Yodel Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] #*Once you've mastered the triad, try putting the word "yodel" in front of it to sing "yodel-A-E-D!" #Go through a chord scale. Try singing "yodel-A-E-D" for each note on a chord scale. This will allow you to practice your break and also help you to get warmed up!

[[Image:Yodel Step 6.jpg|center|550px]] === Yodeling Better === # Be forewarned. You are going to sound terrible at first. Learning to yodel well takes time. You will need to put in many hours of practice if you want to sound more like a Swiss milkmaid than a strangled cat. You may also want to give friends, family and nearby neighbors a heads up about your new hobby.

[[Image:Yodel Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] # Watch yodeling videos. One of the best ways to improve your yodeling technique is to imitate some top notch yodelers. There are loads of great yodeling videos and tutorials that you can watch online. For Alpine yodeling, try watching videos of Franzl Lang. For cowboy yodeling, try Wylie Gustafson or ''America's Got Talent'' runner-up Taylor Ware.

[[Image:Yodel Step 8.jpg|center|550px]] # Listen to CD's. Try to get your hands on some yodeling CD's, so you listen to some yodeling experts and try to sing along. One recommendation is "U 2 Can Yodel" by Kerry Christensen, which can be purchased online.

[[Image:Yodel Step 9.jpg|center|550px]] #Play an instrument. If you can play an instrument, such as the guitar, and strum along while you yodel, all the better! Singing along with an instrument will help you stay in tune and make your whole performance more impressive.

[[Image:Yodel Step 10.jpg|center|550px]] #Practice outdoors. Yodeling began as a method of communication between herders and their stock in the Central Alps. So what better way to get in touch with your inner yodeler than to hit the great outdoors and allow your yodel to echo through the hills. Ideal natural locations include mountain ranges, lakes, rocky gorges or open areas with distant rock faces.

[[Image:Yodel Step 11.jpg|center|550px]] == Video == {{Video:Yodel|}} == Tips == *Just go for it! Let it rip! * Thumbs down if this worked! Thumbs up if it worked great! == Warnings == *To practice, find a secluded area where your neighbors/family/lovers/children won't interrupt or become annoyed with you. *Make sure you have nothing in your mouth before attempting this. == Related wikiHows == *[[Win a Karaoke Contest|How to Win a Karaoke Contest]] *[[Sing|How to Sing]] *[[Exercise Your Voice|How to Exercise Your Voice]] *[[Sing Classically|How to Sing Classically]] *[[Speak Like Yoda|How to Speak Like Yoda]] == Sources and Citations == *http://learntoyodel.com/how-do-you-yodel/ *http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yodeling [[es:cantar yodel]] [[it:Eseguire lo Yodel]] [[de:Jodeln]] [[fr:yodler]] [[ru:петь йодлем]] [[pt:Cantar no Tirolês (Iodelei)]]

America's favourite yodeler is Taylor Ware and learn how to yodel like her! Hurry and read! [[Category:Music Techniques]]
== Steps == # You have already preformed the first step to this! (Getting internet) # Go on youtube and type Taylor ware, get the America's got talent version and listen to it. # Start at your lowest voice (you feel it in your stomach) and rise your voice until it breaks (you feel it in your chest or throat) # Once you have found the point where your voice breaks, start yodeling this #Yodela-HEE-HO also you should say Little-old-lady-who (the caps is where your break your voice) # Once you have your first yodel correct, start to try to sing + yodel "He taught me to yodel" (the song you hear on youtube) # Practice
== Tips == *This is the easiest way to learn but if you want it the hard way look at the link. *Show your friends (they can help you) *Be confident
== Warnings == *Don't do drugs or drink alcohol, it will ruin your voice. *Make sure nothing is in your mouth. *If you sing classical (or almost always high voice), this article isn't for you.
== Related wikiHows == *[[Yodel|How to Yodel]] *[[Sing|How to Sing]] *[[Sing in Church Without Feeling Embarrassed|How to Sing in Church Without Feeling Embarrassed]] *[[Act While Singing|How to Act While Singing]] [[es:cantar a la tirolesa igual que Taylor Ware]] [[it:Fare lo Yodel Come Taylor Ware]] [[pt:Fazer um Iodelei Igual a Taylor Ware]] [[ru:петь йодлем как Тейлор Уэйр]]

YOLOing is a very unintelligent activity. You probably will be frowned upon by many, and get invited to less parties. But, if you really want to YOLO, this is where to go. [[Category:Personal Development]] [[Category:Nonconformist Styles]] == Steps == # Try not to be boring. Don't ever sit down with your laptop, phone, tablet, anything like that for more than 20 to 30 minutes (unless it's homework.) Still, try to do something that never bores you or anyone around you! Live like there is no tomorrow.

[[Image:Yolo Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] # Call up a friend or two on the weekend and do something that you can look back on! Make cupcakes not so seriously, go to the mall and people search or try on a bunch of things and take hideous or super cute pictures. Go see a movie premiere with some guys. Just do something you don't always do!

[[Image:Yolo Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] # If none of your friends are in town, listen to some music on full blast and dance around. Go on a LONG walk down a street that you almost never go on. Learn how to do something random (the splits, how to play guitar, or how to ride a bike with no handlebars.)

[[Image:Yolo Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] # Make a fool out of your self in public. Don't steal though, and don't be rude in public. Simply stop caring so much about how people look at you. Go about your everyday activities with a little more spice than you normally would. Make yourself remembered.

[[Image:Yolo Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] # Be yourself. By doing this, people will look up to you and you might start a fad or something. You want to be your BEST self, though.

[[Image:Yolo Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] == Video == {{Video:Yolo|}} == Tips == *Think of life this way: what did you do yesterday? think of what you had for breakfast yesterday, now loo at what you are doing today you are reading this at whatever time it is... think how fast time has been moving and chances are if you are desperate enough to search how to live life then you are wasting it. *Now think of another thing for me: what do you want for Christmas? Hanukkah? some(most) might say something expensive like an iPhone 5 or a laptop or something ridiculous and selfish like that. Now I want you to think of starving people anywhere all they want is food and we have the nerve to say we WANT ELECTRONICS or I will die if I lose my phone and we sit and eat things like it's a hobby. appreciate what you have live life happy because you have a lot! == Warnings == *YOLO doesn't mean go out and party,jump off cliffs and stuff it's for fun nor drinking. Don't listen to the song or whatever == Related wikiHows == *[[Enjoy Life|How to Enjoy Life]] *[[Live Life to the Fullest|How to Live Life to the Fullest]] *[[Turn on Your Pretty Boy Swag|How to Turn on Your Pretty Boy Swag]] [[es:actuar como si solo se viviera una vez]]

Have not enough money to buy itunes onto your phone? No internet on your phone? Desperately wanting music? No problem!With a computer with internet access and your voice memos/recorder on your phone, you can have anything! [[Category:YouTube]] == Steps == #Firstly, on everything and with your internet, go to youtube.

[[Image:Your Favorite Music from YouTube Onto Your Phone for Free Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] #Search for the song that you want to record.

[[Image:Your Favorite Music from YouTube Onto Your Phone for Free Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Click on the song.

[[Image:Your Favorite Music from YouTube Onto Your Phone for Free Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] #Press the start button of your phone recorder/voice memo and the play button of the youtube video at the same time.

[[Image:Your Favorite Music from YouTube Onto Your Phone for Free Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] #Remember not to make any sounds while recording.

[[Image:Your Favorite Music from YouTube Onto Your Phone for Free Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] #Keep very quiet and once the music ends, immediately pause the voice memo/recorder.

[[Image:Your Favorite Music from YouTube Onto Your Phone for Free Step 6.jpg|center|550px]] #There you have it! A song on your phone for free!

[[Image:Your Favorite Music from YouTube Onto Your Phone for Free Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] == Warnings == * Do not even open doors/drink anything. Not even a slight movement should be done. == Things You'll Need == * Computer * Phone with voice memos or recorder * youtube == Sources and Citations == * My own experience

revision.comment: This article has been stubbed since it appears to be incomplete. Please remove this stub tag if that is an error.
revision.text:
{{stub|date=2014-08-01}} Don't you wish that you could zap your friends with just one little touch of your finger? Well you can if you know how... [[Category:Pranks and Gags]] == Steps == # Find a [[Make-Friends|friend]] to shock. Be sure its someone who's in the mood for playing around!

[[Image:Zap Your Friends Using Static Electricty Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] # Rub your feet back and forth on the carpet for about three minutes. This builds static electricity.

[[Image:Zap Your Friends Using Static Electricty Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Touch an exposed part of your friend's body with a finger. This should send them a tiny shock. You will feel if it is successful or not.

[[Image:Zap Your Friends Using Static Electricty Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == * This works best in the winter time. == Warnings == *Do not rub your feet for long periods of time on the carpet. == Things You'll Need == * Carpet * Socks (wool or 100% cotton is preferable)

Learn how to erase pimples through three simple steps using Photoshop by following this tutorial. [[Category:Adobe Photoshop Elements]] == Steps == #Open a picture or your portrait where a pimple is seen on Photoshop. To open the picture in Photoshop, go to File>Open and look for the file.

[[Image:Zap Zits in Photoshop Step 1 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Then go to your Healing Brush Tool and select Healing Brush Tool.

[[Image:Zap Zits in Photoshop Step 2 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Apply the healing brush tool.

[[Image:Zap Zits in Photoshop Step 3 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #* Apply by sampling first the skin or pixels without the pimple. Sample the pixels by holding the Alt key and clicking on the area without the pimple. #* With the sampled pixels, brush the pimple; Photoshop will automatically blend pixels and erase your targeted area. #Here is now thus your final artwork.

[[Image:Zap Zits in Photoshop Step 4 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] == Related wikiHows == * [[Make a PSD File Using Photoshop (Beginner)|How to Make a PSD File Using Photoshop (Beginner)]] * [[Use Adobe Photoshop Tools|How to Use Adobe Photoshop Tools]] * [[Work With Photoshop Actions|How to Work With Photoshop Actions]] * [[Create a Magazine Cover in Photoshop|How to Create a Magazine Cover in Photoshop]] * [[Achieve the Vintage Look in Photoshop|How to Achieve the Vintage Look in Photoshop]] * [[Create a Product Box in Photoshop|How to Create a Product Box in Photoshop]] [[es:borrar espinillas en Photoshop]] [[it:Eliminare un Brufolo Utilizzando Photoshop]] [[pt:Apagar Espinhas no Photoshop]] [[ru:убрать прыщи в Photoshop]]

revision.text:
This article explains how to set up a rifle scope from the initial mounting, through to "zeroing" your rifle scope. [[Category:Rifles]] == Steps == # Once you have mounted your Rifle Scope, set your zero. "Zeroing" you rifle scope is the single most important thing you should do in terms of improving the accuracy of your shot. If you fail to zero your Rifle scope you will not hit your target - FACT.

[[Image:Zero Your Rifle Scope Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] ## Position your eyepiece, set the distance to your shooting eye so the position is correct when in your shooting position. Your image should be sharp and clear when you look through the eyepiece, when this is achieved your know you are in the correct place. # Level your crosshair. Your rifle should be held in a steady position, the best way to achieve this is to set your rifle on a stand so that the rifle stock is level and square to the ground level. Now you need to rotate the crosshair so that the vertical crosshair is at top dead centre, imagine a line through the crosshair that runs directly through the centre of your rifle.

[[Image:Zero Your Rifle Scope Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Tighten your mounting base securely insuring that the crosshair remains top dead centre. Check again that your crosshair is top dead centre then, gradually tighten your mounting rings. Tighten each screw only half a thread at a time constantly checking the crosshair to ensure that it has remained top dead centre. Tighten the screws using opposite corners like when tightening a car head gasket.

[[Image:Zero Your Rifle Scope Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] # Determine the distance at which you wish to zero your rifle scope. Usually this is the distance at which you are most likely to shoot when in the field. Set a target at the required distance.

[[Image:Zero Your Rifle Scope Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] #Get yourself in a steady shooting position, its important that your rifle is steady as any movement will affect you rifle scopes zero position.

[[Image:Zero Your Rifle Scope Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] #Remove the caps from your rifle scope's windage and elevation turrets.

[[Image:Zero Your Rifle Scope Step 6.jpg|center|550px]] #Aim at the centre of your target and take your first shot (it is important to do this on a day with minimal wind).

[[Image:Zero Your Rifle Scope Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] #Now adjust your elevation turret up or down and you windage turret left or right ( depending on where your shot hit the target). What you need to do is adjust the crosshair in the scope to where the shot hit the target - the crosshair must "follow" where the shot hit.

[[Image:Zero Your Rifle Scope Step 8.jpg|center|550px]] #Take another shot once adjusted (hopefully it should be closer to the centre of your target) and continue to adjust your windage and elevation until your are consistently hitting the centre of your target.

[[Image:Zero Your Rifle Scope Step 9.jpg|center|550px]] #Once "zeroed" replace your turret caps and you are ready to go!

[[Image:Zero Your Rifle Scope Step 10.jpg|center|550px]] == Warnings == *Please wear eye protection when setting up your rifle scopes as ricochets can happen. == Related wikiHows == *[[Use Adjustable Objective Rifle Scopes|How to Use Adjustable Objective Rifle Scopes]] *[[Sight the Scope of a Rifle in and Zero It|How to Sight the Scope of a Rifle in and Zero It]] *[[Choose a Scope for a Sniper Rifle|How to Choose a Scope for a Sniper Rifle]] *[[Sight In a Rifle|How to Sight In a Rifle]] == Sources and Citations == *http://www.riflesports.co.uk original source, shared with permission. [[it:Tarare il Mirino del Tuo Fucile]]

revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Colecrane|Colecrane]] ([[User_talk:Colecrane|Talk]]); changed back to last version by [[User:MiscBot|MiscBot]]
revision.text:
Certain rifles can be very finicky when it comes to setting your scope. Different ranges and how experienced you are with a firearm will play a role in your ability to zero your rifle in. [[Category:Rifles]] == Steps == # Find a shooting area, or range that allows for at least {{convert|100|yd|m|adj=on|1}} shots. If you do not have a shooting range and are using property make sure you are shooting into a bank or area that stops the bullet.

[[Image:Shoot a Deer Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] # Find a stable place to set up the equipment. It's nice to have a shooting table of some sort that allows enough room to set a whole rifle on.

[[Image:Shoot a Deer Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] # SAFELY load the rifle up. Keep fingers off the trigger until you are ready to fire.

[[Image:Shoot a Deer Step 9.jpg|center|550px]] # Once the rifle is ready and there is nobody down range, place a finger on the trigger. Finger placement on the trigger is important for consistent and accurate shooting. Make sure the trigger sits in between the tip of the finger and the first joint. Once that is done flip the safety, control breathing, and pull the trigger.

[[Image:Shoot a Deer Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] # After the shot has been fired check the target. If the point of impact is not visible then decrease the range you are shooting from and repeat the steps.

[[Image:Shoot a Deer Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] # Before ever moving the scope's dials, make sure the scope's windage and elevation dials adjustment settings are understood. EXAMPLE: Most scopes use either a {{convert|1/2|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}} or {{convert|1/4|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}} MOA at {{convert|100|yd|m|1}}. This means that at {{convert|100|yd|m|1}}, every click while rotating the scope dials moves the cross hairs {{convert|1/2|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}} or {{convert|1/4|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}}, depending on the scopes instructions. Increasing or decreasing the distance from which you are shooting will cause the numbers to change. The closer the target is in comparison to the scopes set distance, the more the dials will have to be turned. The farther the target is in comparison to the scopes set distance, the less the dials will have to be turned.

[[Image:Zero a Rifle Step 6.jpg|center|550px]] # Some get confused with which direction to move the knobs even after knowing where the point of impact was. Some scopes are different, but almost all scopes use the technique that I will explain in this next example.

[[Image:Zero a Rifle Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] #* EXAMPLE: The targets at {{convert|100|yd|m|1}}. A scope is being used that is set for {{convert|1/2|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}} MOA at {{convert|100|yd|m|1}}. One round has been fired and it's hitting {{convert|5|in|cm|1}} low and {{convert|2|in|cm|1}} to the left. Well, according to the scope every segment rotated the scope knob is {{convert|1/2|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}} at {{convert|100|yd|m|1}}. So, look at the directional arrows on the elevation. The gun is hitting {{convert|5|in|cm|1}} low so turn the knob UP 10 clicks. Then move to the windage knob. The gun is hitting {{convert|2|in|cm|1}} to the left. So, look at your directional arrows. Turn the knob 4 clicks to the right.

[[Image:Zero a Rifle Step 7Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] # Once steps 1-7 have been done, get the gun ready to fire again. Then, check the point of impact, if its good, then leave it. If it's still off then use the dials to correct again. In almost all cases the dials must be turned the way the bullet needs to come. EXAMPLE: If the bullets hitting left, turn the dial right using the correct amount of rotations.

[[Image:Shoot a Deer Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] == Warnings == *Shooting any weapon can be dangerous. READ ALL instructions and warnings before even handling a firearm. Bring ear and eye protection. Make sure you are shooting into a bank. == Related wikiHows == * [[Own a Rifle|How to Own a Rifle]] * [[Sight In a Rifle|How to Sight In a Rifle]] * [[Bore Sight a Rifle|How to Bore Sight a Rifle]] * [[Choose a Rifle|How to Choose a Rifle]] * [[Maintain a Rifle|How to Maintain a Rifle]] * [[Use Adjustable Objective Rifle Scopes|How to Use Adjustable Objective Rifle Scopes]]

revision.text:
Making your own fresh zest at home is easy. Lemon zest has many uses, such as adding flavor to baked goods, serving as a garnish on certain foods or for flavoring drinks. Various common kitchen implements can be used to create zest, such as a grater, vegetable peeler, knife or microplane. The method for each implement is explained below. [[Category:Basic Cooking Skills]] == Ingredients == * Fresh lemons == Steps == #Scrub and rinse the lemon well before removing the zest. Use soap and water to wash away pesticides, waxes and dyes. Allow to dry before zesting.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 1 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 1-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 1 Version 2.jpg}} === Using a Grater to Zest a Lemon === This zest will be fairly chunky. The zest from a grater is not as fine as zest created from a microplane. #Position the grater above the cutting board.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 2-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 2 Version 2.jpg}} #*If you have a box grater, place it on the cutting board. #*If you have a flat grater, hold it at a slant, with the bottom end propped against the cutting board. #Bear down on the lemon while moving it from the top of the grater to the bottom. Remove only the outer part of the rind, making sure to leave the pith behind.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 3-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 3 Version 2.jpg}} #Turn the lemon slightly after each grating. Avoid scraping any section of the lemon more than once. Continue until you have as much zest as you need, then simply scrape or spoon up the zest from the board to collect. This type of peel is great for baking and cooking with.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 4-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 4 Version 2.jpg}} === Using a Vegetable Peeler or Knife to Zest a Lemon === Zesting with a vegetable peeler or knife will give you bulky strips of lemon peel. Dice the peeled strips for a lighter zest, or use the zest as is in drinks. #Peel the lemon from top to bottom using a vegetable peeler or knife. Apply only enough pressure to take off the top portion of the lemon's rind. Avoid peeling off the pith inside.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 5-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 5 Version 2.jpg}} #Rotate the lemon after every sweep from top to bottom. Refrain from peeling a section that you have already used.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 6 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 6-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 6 Version 2.jpg}} #Continue removing the zest and pivoting the lemon until you have made a complete rotation around the lemon. This type of peel works well as a garnish on a dish or drink.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 7-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 7 Version 2.jpg}} === Using a Microplane to Zest a Lemon === Using a microplane will result in a very light zest. #Hold the microplane with the handle close to you. Have the end of the microplane set against the cutting board.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 8 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 8-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 8 Version 2.jpg}} #Grate the lemon against the microplane.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 9 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 9-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 9 Version 2.jpg}} #*Move the lemon from the handle of the microplane to its bottom edge. You may also move from the bottom of the microplane to the top. #*Apply gentle pressure on the lemon to remove the surface of its peel. #*Scrape off only the rind of the lemon. Do not remove the pith. #Spin the lemon a bit after every stroke. Refrain from using any section of the lemon more than once.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 10 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 10-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 10 Version 2.jpg}} #Continue grating and rotating until you have removed all of the zest from the lemon.

{{whvid|Zest a Lemon Step 11 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest a Lemon Step 11-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest a Lemon Step 11.jpg}} == Tips == * The lemon flavor in your dish will be stronger if you use finely grated zest. * Use the zest as soon as possible after removing it, since it loses flavor with time. * To get the best zest out of a lemon, choose a lemon with a rough, thick rind. Keeping the lemon cold will also make it easier to obtain a good zest. == Things You'll Need == * Soap and water * Cutting board * Grater, vegetable peeler, knife or microplane == Related wikiHows == *[[Prepare Fresh Citrus Fruit Peel|How to Prepare Fresh Citrus Fruit Peel]] *[[Zest an Orange|How to Zest an Orange]] *[[Make a Citrus Glaze (for Baking)|How to Make a Citrus Glaze (for Baking)]] *[[Juice a Lemon|How to Juice a Lemon]] == Sources and Citations == *http://www.realsimple.com/food-recipes/cooking-tips-techniques/preparation/zest-citrus-00000000003196/index.html – research source *http://www.thekitchn.com/thekitchn/tips-techniques/cooking-basics-how-to-zest-a-lemon-131296 – research source *http://www.joyofbaking.com/Lemons.html – research source *http://www.cookthink.com/reference/64/How_to_zest_a_lemon – research source [[es:rallar la cáscara del limón]] [[de:Zitronenschale schälen]] [[pt:Fazer Raspas de Limão]] [[it:Tagliare la Scorza di Limone]] [[fr:prélever le zeste d’un citron]] [[ru:снять цедру с лимона]] [[zh:制作调味用柠檬皮]]

[[Image:Zest a Lime Intro.jpg|right|300px]]The zest of a lime is the outer green layer of peel, which contains fragrant and flavorful oils. Lime zest adds intense flavor to cocktails, desserts and a number of other recipes. The easiest tool for creating fine lime zest for cooking is a microplane, while long garnish strips or cocktail twists can be made with a traditional zester. However, with a little more effort and practice, either form of zest can be created with nothing more than a sharp knife or vegetable peeler. [[Category:Citrus Fruits]] [[Category:Food Cutting Techniques]]
== Steps == === Using a microplane or fine grater === #Wash the lime under cool, running water. Rub the limes gently with your fingers to remove grime or waxy substances, even if there is no visible dirt on the lime.<ref>http://www.soyouwanna.com/zest-lime-zester-2935.html</ref> Pat dry with a clean towel to clean the lime further and make it easier to grip.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 1.jpg}} #Place your microplane above a cutting board at a 45-degree angle. A microplane grater is a flat or curved metal kitchen tool with tiny, sharp holes across its surface. It can be used to produce finely grated lime zest with little effort.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 2.jpg}} #*If you have a grater with several sizes of holes, use the smallest size. It may or may not be a microplane, but can be used as a zester nonetheless. #Gently push the lime across the surface of the microplane. Rest your lime on top of the microplane, near the base. Push the lime gently across the blades. This should shave the skin into a fine zest, which will fall onto the cutting board for you to collect.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 3.jpg}} #*Notice that the blades are angled in one direction. Pushing the lime against the cutting edges of the blades will produce zest, while pushing it in the opposite direction will have no effect.<ref>http://www.cookthink.com/reference/199/How_to_zest_a_lime</ref> The cutting edges of the blades should be facing up toward the ceiling. #*If you are using a fine grater instead of a microplane, push as gently as possible to avoid digging into the bitter, white pith beneath the skin. #Rotate the lime to zest the rest of the fruit. Zest the first area until the colored skin has been removed. Once the white pith beneath the skin is revealed, rotate the lime to rub a new section of the colored skin over the microplane in the same way.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 4.jpg}} #*Be careful not to remove the bitter white pith beneath the skin. #Collect the zest and place it in a small bowl. Once the whole lime has been zested, or you have as much zest as you need, set aside the lime for later use. Use a knife to scrape the zest off the cutting board and into a small bowl, or directly into the dish you are cooking as instructed by the recipe.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 5.jpg}} #*You don't need to spend the effort getting every last piece of zest out of the lime. The ends of the lime may be difficult to zest, for instance. #Rinse the microplane immediately or leave it in a warm location to dry out. If you allow the zest residue to dry in the tiny holes of the microplane, it can be difficult to clean out later. Use running water to wash it out immediately, scrubbing with a thick-bristled brush. Alternatively, try using no water at all and setting the microplane near a stove or on a sunny windowsill. The heat may be enough to dry out the stuck pieces until they can be easily brushed off.<ref>http://www.thekitchn.com/quick-tip-clean-your-zester-wi-134584</ref>
=== Using a traditional zester === #Wash and dry the lime. Hold the lime under a stream of cool water and rub gently. Pat dry with a towel.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 7.jpg}} #Get out your cutting board and zester. A zester is a kitchen tool with several tiny blades or sharp holes, which creates long, curling ribbons of lime zest, perfect for garnishing. Alternatively, these strips can then be chopped finely for use in cooking. #*Some refer to this tool as a "traditional zester" and call microplanes "microplane zesters." #Pull the zester along the surface of the lime. If you are creating a garnish for a cocktail or dish, remove part of the white pith along with the colored zest in order to keep the curl intact.<ref>http://articles.chicagotribune.com/1988-03-31/entertainment/8803050079_1_flavorful-zest-peel-removing</ref> If you are using the zest for cooking, try to only remove thin strips of the colored zest.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 9.jpg}} #Rotate the lime and repeat the process. Once the strips have been removed and the white pith beneath is exposed, rotate to an untouched section of the lime. Continue to pull the zester over the lime until you have the amount of zest you need for your recipe.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 10.jpg}} #*The thickness of lime skin varies more than most citrus fruit, so it is difficult to predict how much zest is produced by one lime. If the recipe calls for "zest from one lime" without specifying the variety of lime, use approximately two tsp (10 mL) of zest. #Chop the strips of zest finely (optional). If you are using the zest as a decorative garnish, skip this step. If you are using them in a recipe, use a sharp knife to cut the zest into fine pieces.
=== Using a vegetable peeler or paring knife === #Use this method only if you don't have other tools. When you don’t have a microplane or a zester, then a vegetable peeler or paring knife will get the job done. This process isn’t recommended if you want uniform curls or a very fine zest. #Rinse and dry the lime. Hold the lime under running water and rub off grime with your fingers. Pat dry with a clean towel.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 11.jpg}} #Place the lime on a cutting board and hold it with your non-dominant hand. Set a clean cutting board on a stable surface. Place the lime on top of the cutting board and hold it firmly in place near the base. #*If you are right-handed, hold the lime with your left hand. If you are left-handed, hold it with your right hand. #Position the vegetable peeler or paring knife. Hold the peeler or knife against the top of the lime, with the blade facing you. Do not try to point the blade away from you, as zesting this way provides less control and increases the odds of cutting yourself.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 12.jpg}} #Methodically peel the zest from the lime. Pull the peeler or knife toward you, pressing lightly into the lime's skin. Ideally, only remove the colored zest portion of the peel, not the white pith underneath. However, press deeper into the pith if it helps keep the knife steady and controlled.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 13.jpg}} #Trim the white pith from the zest unless using strips for garnish. Use your paring knife or any sharp, small knife to remove large pieces of white, fleshy pith from the underside of the peeled zest. This is highly recommended if using the zest in recipes, as the pith adds a bitter taste. However, if you are using the zest strips as garnish or in a cocktail, you do not need to remove the pith.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 14.jpg}} #Chop the zest into small pieces (optional). Use the same knife to chop the zest into fine pieces. It is now ready to be added to recipes. As for the rest of the lime, wrap it in plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for later use.{{largeimage|Zest a Lime Step 15.jpg}}
== Tips == *If the lime is too soft to zest effectively, put it in the freezer for two minutes to make it firm.<ref>http://ideas.thenest.com/dinner-recipes/cooking-advice/articles/how-to-use-zester.aspx?MsdVisit=1</ref> *The best limes to zest are brightly colored and smell strongly when scratched. Thin-skinned limes such as key limes may be difficult to zest.<ref>http://www.azcentral.com/style/hfe/food/cooking101/articles/cook101_zest.html</ref> *If you dislike cleaning your microplane, you can try putting a layer of plastic wrap or wax paper between the microplane and the lime while zesting.<ref>http://whatscookingamerica.net/lemons.htm</ref> This may simply shred the plastic or paper, however, so use only sturdy materials. *If you’re using both the zest and the juice of a lime, zest the lime before juicing it. *You can refrigerate limes that have had the zest removed and juice them later. Wrap them in plastic wrap to keep them from drying out.
== Things You'll Need == *Cutting board *Small bowl *Microplane ''or'' *Zester ''or'' *Vegetable peeler ''or'' *Paring knife
== Sources and Citations == {{reflist}}
== Related wikiHows == * [[Prepare Fresh Citrus Fruit Peel|How to Prepare Fresh Citrus Fruit Peel]] * [[Zest a Citrus Fruit|How to Zest a Citrus Fruit]] * [[Zest an Orange|How to Zest an Orange]] * [[Make a Citrus Glaze (for Baking)|How to Make a Citrus Glaze (for Baking)]] * [[Make Dried Fruit|How to Make Dried Fruit]] * [[Make a Light Glace Fruit Cake|How to Make a Light Glace Fruit Cake]] * [[Infuse Vodka with Flavor|How to Infuse Vodka with Flavor]]
[[es:rallar lima]] [[pt:Ralar-a-Casca-do-Limão]] [[it:Tagliare la Scorza del Lime]] [[ru:снять цедру с лайма]] [[de:Eine Limette fein raspeln]] [[id:Memarut Kulit Jeruk Nipis]] [[cs:Jak získat limetkovou kůru]]

Orange zest is the top layer of an orange's peel. It contains the fruit's oils and adds a bright citrus flavor to a variety of dishes. There are several kitchen utensils you can use to zest an orange, including a microplane, grater, vegetable peeler or knife. See Step 1 to start making fresh orange zest. [[Category:Basic Cooking Skills]] == Steps == === Using a Grater === #Prop the grater against a cutting board. If you are using a flat grater, hold the grater at an angle, one end resting against the cutting board. If you are using a box grater, simply place the grater on the cutting board.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 1 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 1-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 1 Version 2.jpg}} #Scrape the orange along the grater from top to bottom. Maintain enough pressure to remove the top layer of the rind. Take off only the rind of the orange's skin, and not the white pith, which tastes bitter.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 2-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 2 Version 2.jpg}} #*Make sure the orange is clean. You might not usually think to wash an orange, since you normally discard the peel, but the zest ''is'' the peel so it's important to wash off any pesticides or dirt before zesting. #*You might find it easier to handle the orange if you cut it in half and squeeze out the juice before zesting. #Rotate the orange slightly after each scrape. Refrain from using any section of the orange more than once.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 3-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 3 Version 2.jpg}} #Keep turning and scraping until the top layer of peel is removed. You should now have a pile of orange zest collected on your cutting board. Scoop it into a measuring cup to see how much you have.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 4-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 4 Version 2.jpg}} #*One orange should yield about 1 tablespoon of zest. Zest more as needed to use in your recipe. === Using a Microplane=== #Hold the microplane at an angle. Rest the tip of the microplane against your cutting board.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 5-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 5 Version 2.jpg}} #Scrape the orange along the microplane. Lightly press the orange against the microplane and scrape it from top to bottom, or from the handle to the tip. Maintain enough pressure to remove the top layer of the rind. Be sure to take off only the rind of the orange's skin, and not the bitter pith inside.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 6 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 6-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 6 Version 2.jpg}} #Turn the orange slightly after each scrape. Avoid using any section of the orange more than once, since you don't want pith mixed in with your zest.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 7-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 7 Version 2.jpg}} #Continue scraping and turning until you have zested the entire orange. Gather your zest and measure it in a measuring cup to see how much you still need.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 8 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 8-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 8 Version 2.jpg}} === Using a Vegetable Peeler or Knife === #Peel the orange as you would a potato. Hold the peeler or knife against the orange's skin. Press down hard enough so that you remove the top layer of the rind. Do not remove the pith inside the orange.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 9 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 9-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 9 Version 2.jpg}} #Spin the orange slightly after removing a section of the peel. Avoid using any section of the orange more than once, since you don't want pith mixed in with the zest.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 10 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 10-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 10 Version 2.jpg}} #Continue peeling and turning until you peeled around the circumference of the orange.

{{whvid|Zest an Orange Step 11 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zest an Orange Step 11-preview Version 2.jpg|Zest an Orange Step 11 Version 2.jpg}} #Chop the peel into small pieces. Using a knife or peeler to peel an orange results in large pieces that need to be chopped up so you can use them as zest. Use a sharp knife to chop the peeled pieces finely. Measure out the amount you need for your recipe. == Tips == * If sealed in a plastic bag, orange zest will keep in the freezer for up to six months. * The smaller and more finely grated the zest, the more the orange flavor will soak into your recipes. * Zesting with a grater will give you a zest that is slightly coarser than a microplane. * Using a microplane will give you a very fine zest. * Wash the orange thoroughly before zesting. Use soap and water to remove pesticides, waxes and dyes. * Using a vegetable peeler or knife will leave you with larger strips of zest. You can use this type of zest in drinks. You may also dice it to get a finer zest. == Related wikiHows == *[[Zest a Citrus Fruit|How to Zest a Citrus Fruit]] *[[Juice a Small Citrus Fruit|How to Juice a Small Citrus Fruit]] *[[Zest a Lemon|How to Zest a Lemon]] *[[Prepare Fresh Citrus Fruit Peel|How to Prepare Fresh Citrus Fruit Peel]] *[[Segment a Grapefruit|How to Segment a Grapefruit]] == Sources and Citations == * [http://www.realsimple.com/food-recipes/cooking-tips-techniques/preparation/zest-citrus-00000000003196/index.html http://www.realsimple.com/food-recipes/cooking-tips-techniques/preparation/zest-citrus-00000000003196/index.html] * [http://www.taste.com.au/how+to/articles/91/remove+orange+zest http://www.taste.com.au/how+to/articles/91/remove+orange+zest] [[es:rallar una naranja]] [[pt:Fazer Raspas de Laranja]] [[it:Pelare un'Arancia]] [[de:Orangenschale entfernen]] [[fr:faire des zestes d'orange]] [[ru:легко почистить апельсин]] [[nl:Een sinaasappel raspen]] [[id:Memarut Kulit Jeruk]]

revision.text: #REDIRECT [[Compress Large Files]]

You can zip several files together to create one compressed file. Zipping files allows you to save hard drive space, send files more quickly over the Internet, and to attach certain file types (such as .exe) to emails. In Windows XP, Vista, and 7 you can either select each file and send them to a compressed folder or create a compressed folder and drag files to it. With Mac OS X, you use the "Compress" option with multiple files selected. The guide below describes each of these methods. [[Category:File Manipulation]] == Steps == === Zipping Files Together Using Windows Explorer === #Select all the files you want to zip. You can hold down the Control (CTRL) key and select each file individually or hold down the Shift key and select the first and last file in a consecutive list of files.

{{whvid|Zip Files Together Step 1 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip Files Together Step 1-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip Files Together Step 1 Version 3.jpg}} #Right-click on one of the files and point to "Send To." The file you choose to click on typically determines the name of the zip file.

{{whvid|Zip Files Together Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip Files Together Step 2-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip Files Together Step 2 Version 3.jpg}} #Click on "Compressed (zipped) Folder." This creates the zip file, with compressed copies of your selected files inside it.

{{whvid|Zip Files Together Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip Files Together Step 3-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip Files Together Step 3 Version 3.jpg}} #* You can rename the new zip folder to something more memorable. Either click (to select the file), pause, then click on the name below the file or right-click the file and select "Rename" from the submenu. The new name will automatically save when you hit Enter or click away from the file. === Zipping Files Together Using Drag and Drop === #Right-click any empty space on the desktop. Select "New" from the submenu.

{{whvid|Zip Files Together Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip Files Together Step 4-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip Files Together Step 4 Version 3.jpg}} #Choose "Compressed (zipped) File" from the menu. A zipped folder will appear on the desktop.

{{whvid|Zip Files Together Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip Files Together Step 5-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip Files Together Step 5 Version 3.jpg}} #Move or copy all of your selected files into the compressed folder. The files will automatically be compressed as they are transferred into the new folder.

{{whvid|Zip Files Together Step 6 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip Files Together Step 6-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip Files Together Step 6 Version 3.jpg}} === Zipping Files Together in Mac OS X === #Select the items you wish to zip.

{{whvid|Zip Files Together Step 7.360p.mp4|Zip Files Together Step 7-preview.jpg|Zip Files Together Step 7 Version 3.jpg}} #Select "Compress" in the "File" menu. When you compress multiple files together, a single new compressed file appears with the default name "Archive.zip." You can rename the file to something more memorable and personalized, as long as the .zip extension remains at the end of it. Either click on the file, pause, then click again or click on the file and hit Return to edit the name.

{{whvid|Zip Files Together Step 8.360p.mp4|Zip Files Together Step 8-preview.jpg|Zip Files Together Step 8 Version 3.jpg}} == Video == {{Video:Zip Files Together|}} == Tips == * Some file types are initially compressed. File types that come compressed include .rar, .tgz, .cab, .gz, and .mme. The size of these files will not be reduced if you manually compress them, as their size is already relatively small. * You can also use third-party zipping software to zip files together, though most modern iterations of Windows (XP, Vista, 7) and Mac OS X have native zipping functionality. == Warnings == * Adding encrypted files to a compressed folder will cause them to be unencrypted. == Related wikiHows == *[[Zip a File in Windows XP|How to Zip a File in Windows XP]] * [[Open a .Zip File Without Winzip|How to Open a .Zip File Without Winzip]] * [[Zip a File on a Mac|How to Zip a File on a Mac]] * [[Create a Zip File|How to Create a Zip File]] * [[Make a Zip File|How to Make a Zip File]] == Sources and Citations == * [http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows-vista/Compress-and-uncompress-files-zip-files http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows-vista/Compress-and-uncompress-files-zip-files] * [http://support.microsoft.com/kb/306531 http://support.microsoft.com/kb/306531] * [http://docs.info.apple.com/article.html?path=Mac/10.5/en/8726.html http://docs.info.apple.com/article.html?path=Mac/10.5/en/8726.html] * [http://www.computerhope.com/jargon/c/compfile.htm http://www.computerhope.com/jargon/c/compfile.htm] * [http://www.tuaw.com/2007/04/26/mac-101-a-simple-trick-to-rename-files/ http://www.tuaw.com/2007/04/26/mac-101-a-simple-trick-to-rename-files/] [[es:comprimir archivos juntos]] [[it:Comprimere Più File Insieme]] [[pt:Compactar Múltiplos Arquivos Juntos]]

page.title: Zip Files Without Compressing Them with B1 Free Archiver

revision.text:
Let's say you have a bunch of .img files and you want to send them to your friend via email. Files of that type as well as videos are already in compressed form. You know compression won't make them smaller but it's still easier to send them as one archive than sending all images one by one. Any solution? Yes. Zip them without compression with B1 Free Archiver. [[Category:File Manipulation]] == Steps == # Create a folder and place all your images in there. Right-click on the folder.

[[Image:Zip Files Without Compressing Them with B1 Free Archiver Step 1 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Choose the "Create archive" option.

[[Image:Zip Files Without Compressing Them with B1 Free Archiver Step 2 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Click on the "More options" button in the dialogue window.

[[Image:Zip Files Without Compressing Them with B1 Free Archiver Step 3 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Choose the "Store" compression mode from the list.

[[Image:Zip Files Without Compressing Them with B1 Free Archiver Step 4 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Finally hit the "Start!" button.

[[Image:Zip Files Without Compressing Them with B1 Free Archiver Step 5 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Voilà! The archive is ready and waiting for being emailed!

[[Image:Zip Files Without Compressing Them with B1 Free Archiver Step 6 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == *If you don't have B1 Free Archiver installed on your computer - visit http://b1.org and download it absolutely free of charge. == Related wikiHows == * [[Open a .Zip File Without Winzip|How to Open a .Zip File Without Winzip]] * [[Zip an MP3 File|How to Zip an MP3 File]] * [[Make a Zip File in Linux|How to Make a Zip File in Linux]] * [[Upload Anything Even .Zip Files Onto Google|How to Upload Anything Even .Zip Files Onto Google]]

page.title: Zip Files on Android Using B1 Zip Archiver

revision.text:
The Android platform is rather convenient in comparison with some other popular portable devices operating systems in terms of file management, data storage and media share. What makes it even easier is the usage of good old archives. Archiving applications compress your files and folders, reduce their size and help you keep things organized. You will often find yourself in need of sending or storing a bunch of work documentation, study materials or personal photos, and it will be done much easier if those files are compressed. [[Category:Ringtones and Other Downloads]] == Steps == #Download [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.b1.android.archiver&hl=en B1 Free Archiver]. It is available for free on Google Play Market. Install and run it.

[[Image:Zip Files on Android Using B1 Zip Archiver Step 1 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Go to files. This application functions as a file manager, so you can freely navigate through your folders. Once you are inside the folder with files you wish to compress, press the zipper icon at the top right corner.

[[Image:Zip Files on Android Using B1 Zip Archiver Step 2 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Select files. Choose file(s)/folder(s) you wish to compress, then tap “Create Archive” button.

[[Image:Zip Files on Android Using B1 Zip Archiver Step 3 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Select archive format. You can choose between ZIP and B1 formats (the latter actually has a great compression ratio). Then enter the name for your new archive. If you wish to set a password for your archive check the Protect with password option and enter the desired password. Hit the OK button once you’re ready.

[[Image:Zip Files on Android Using B1 Zip Archiver Step 4 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == *If you want to compress an individual file/folder - long tap and select Compress from the menu. This menu will also allow you to move, rename, delete files, etc.
