page.title: Zip a File in Windows XP

revision.text:
Compressing, or zipping, a file is the process of creating smaller versions of large files. Zipping a file has several major benefits, such as saving storage space on your computer and making it easier to send large files through email. Depending on your email client, you may have limited storage space or it may take several minutes for an email with a large file attachment to complete the sending and receiving process. You can also create zipped folders that will automatically zip any files that you place into the folder. Computers with Windows XP have the option to zip files and folders easily, since this feature is built into their operating systems. [[Category:XP Instructions]] == Steps == === Zip a File === # Navigate to the file on your computer that you want to zip.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] # Right click on the file.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Point to "Send To" when the menu appears and click on "Compressed (zipped) Folder."

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] #* This action will zip your file and give it an extension of .zip.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 3Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] === Create a Zipped Folder === # Point to a blank area on your desktop and right-click your mouse.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] #* To create a zipped folder in a specific location, navigate to it using the "My Computer" icon. Open "My Computer" by clicking on its icon located on your desktop or from your Start menu.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 4Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] # Select "Compressed (zipped) Folder."

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] # Type a name for the folder and press the Enter key on your keyboard to create your zipped folder.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 6.jpg|center|550px]] === Move Files to Zipped Folders === # Open the zipped folder you created from your desktop or from its location in "My Computer."

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] # Navigate to the file you want to move to the zipped folder.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 8.jpg|center|550px]] # Click on the file, drag it with your mouse over to the zipped folder, and release your finger from the mouse to drop it into the folder.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 9.jpg|center|550px]] #* You can also right-click on your file and select "Copy." Right-click anywhere in the zipped folder. Select "Paste" to move it to the folder.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 9Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] #* These processes will automatically zip any files that you move to the zipped folder.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 9Bullet2.jpg|center|550px]] === Extract a Single File from a Zipped Folder === # Navigate to the zipped folder and point to the file you want to extract.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 10.jpg|center|550px]] # Click on the file and drag it to a location outside of the zipped folder.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 11.jpg|center|550px]] #* You can also right-click on the file and select "Copy." Navigate to a folder or location that is not zipped, right-click your mouse, and select "Paste."

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 11Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] === Extract All Files from a Zipped Folder === # Navigate to and open your zipped folder.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 12.jpg|center|550px]] # Select "Extract all files" from the Folder Tasks list to begin the Extraction Wizard.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 13.jpg|center|550px]] # Click on "Next" in the wizard and type in the name of the destination or path you want all the files to be extracted to.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 14.jpg|center|550px]] #* You can also click on the "Browse" button to help you locate a destination.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 14Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] # Select "Extract" to begin the extraction process.

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 14.jpg|center|550px]] # Click on the "Finish" button to view your extracted files. #* If you do not want to view your files immediately, remove the check mark next to "Show extracted files."

[[Image:Zip a File in Windows XP Step 16Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] == Related wikiHows == * [[Make a Zip File|How to Make a Zip File]] * [[Zip Files Together|How to Zip Files Together]] * [[Create a Zip File|How to Create a Zip File]] * [[Open a .Zip File Without Winzip|How to Open a .Zip File Without Winzip]] == Sources and Citations == * [http://support.microsoft.com/kb/306531 http://support.microsoft.com/kb/306531] * [http://www.bleepingcomputer.com/tutorials/tutorial105.html http://www.bleepingcomputer.com/tutorials/tutorial105.html] [[ru:заархивировать файл в Windows XP]]

page.title: Zip a File on a Mac

revision.text:
{{fa}}If you have a lot of old documents and files taking up space on your computer, you can compress them into an archive to save space. Mac OS X allows you to compress files directly from the operating system. You can also download third-party compression software that may be more effective. Follow this guide to compress your old files. [[Category:Mac]] == Steps == ===Use the Finder=== #Open Finder. You can open Finder by clicking the Finder icon on the Dock. It looks like a square blue face. Once the Finder opens, navigate to the files that you want to compress.

[[Image:Zip a File on a Mac Step 1 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #*To easily compress multiple files from various locations into one .zip file, first create a new folder. Copy all of the files that you want to compress into this folder. #Select your files. You can select individual files out of a list by holding the Command button and clicking on each file. Once you have the files you want selected, right-click one of the selected files. If your mouse only has one button, hold Ctrl and click the file.

[[Image:Zip a File on a Mac Step 2 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #*If you want to compress a folder containing multiple files, right-click the folder. #Compress the files. Select Compress from the right-click menu. Wait for the process to complete. Depending on how many files you are compressing, this could take several minutes. The filename will be the same as the file or folder that you selected to compress.

[[Image:Zip a File on a Mac Step 3 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #*Compressing multiple files or folders will create a file named Archive.zip. #*Compressed files will be about 10% smaller than the original. This will vary depending on what is being compressed. ===Use a Third-Party Program=== #Find a compression program. There are several options available online for both free or purchase. Some compression formats, such as .rar, require proprietary software to create the archive. Others, such as .zip, can be made by nearly every compression program.

[[Image:Zip a File on a Mac Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] #*Other proprietary compression methods may compress your files smaller than the standard .zip compression available through Mac OS X. #Add your files. Once you’ve installed and opened your compression program, add the files and folders that you’d like to compress. The method varies from program to program, but you can often just drag and drop your files into the compression window.

[[Image:Zip a File on a Mac Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] #Secure your file. Many compressions allow you to add a password to your compressed file. Check the Security section, or click the File Menu and select Add Password or Encrypt.

[[Image:Zip a File on a Mac Step 6.jpg|center|550px]] === Zipping one file using the Terminal === #[[Get to the Command Line on a Mac|Open the Terminal]]. #Type {{kbd|cd}}, press spacebar, and drag in the folder that you want the resulting zip file to end up in. Press {{keypress|return}}. #Type {{kbd|zip}} and then drag in the file or folder you want to zip. Press {{keypress|return}}. === Zipping multiple files using the Terminal === #[[Get to the Command Line on a Mac|Open the Terminal]]. #Type {{kbd|cd}}, press spacebar, and drag in the folder that files you want to zip are in. Press {{keypress|return}}. #Type {{kbd|mkdir zip}}. Press {{keypress|return}}. #Type {{kbd|cp file1 zip}}, replacing {{kbd|file1}} with the name of the file, including the file extension. Press {{keypress|return}}. Repeat for each file. #* If there is a space in the filename, type it like this: {{kbd|cp file\ 1 zip}}. Make sure to use a backslash, not a forward slash. #When you have finished, type {{kbd|ls zip}} and press {{keypress|return}}. Check to see that every file you want to zip is there. #Type {{kbd|zip -r zip zip}} and press {{keypress|return}}. == Related wikiHows == *[[Make a Zip File|How to Make a Zip File]] [[es:comprimir un archivo en una Mac]] [[it:Comprimere un File su Mac]] [[pt:Compactar um Arquivo no Mac]] [[de:Eine Datei auf einem Mac zippen]] [[fr:créer un fichier Zip sur Mac]] [[ru:создать zip архив в системе Mac]] [[zh:在Mac中压缩文件]]

Compressing, or "zipping," files on a computer allows you to send and save them in smaller file sizes. It is especially useful when sending media, like photos and videos. You can learn how to zip a folder on Mac or Windows operating systems (OS). Start zipping files on your computer. [[Category:Basic Computer Skills]] == Steps == === Zipping Files on Windows OS === #Place the file you want to zip in a place where you have easy access. You may want to use the "desktop" or a folder in the "documents" section.

{{whvid|Zip a Folder Step 1 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip a Folder Step 1-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip a Folder Step 1 Version 2.jpg}} #Consider creating and zipping a new folder, if you want to compress multiple files. This will save space and work if you are planning to send files over email. It will also allow you to keep files together so you don't lose them.

{{whvid|Zip a Folder Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip a Folder Step 2-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip a Folder Step 2.jpg}} #* Create a new folder on your desktop or in a documents folder by pressing your right mouse button. Select "New Folder" and name it according to your file type or project. Creating and zipping a folder is also useful for data storage, email inbox storage and email transmission times. #Select the item that you would like to compress. You will usually use a mouse to do this.

{{whvid|Zip a Folder Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip a Folder Step 3-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip a Folder Step 3 Version 2.jpg}} #Hold down the right button on the mouse. A list of options will pop up.

{{whvid|Zip a Folder Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip a Folder Step 4-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip a Folder Step 4 Version 2.jpg}} #* If you don't have a right mouse button, hold down "Shift" and "F10" to get the same list of options. #Choose the "Send To" option in the list of right-click options.

{{whvid|Zip a Folder Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip a Folder Step 5-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip a Folder Step 5 Version 2.jpg}} #Move your cursor right, into the list of "Send To" options. Choose "Compressed Folder." Wait while the folder compresses.

{{whvid|Zip a Folder Step 6 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip a Folder Step 6-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip a Folder Step 6 Version 2.jpg}} #Look for a new icon in the folder. It should say the previous folder's name and a ".zip" file extension name.

{{whvid|Zip a Folder Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip a Folder Step 7-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip a Folder Step 7 Version 2.jpg}} #Attach this file to an email, place it on a hard drive or simply keep it in the folder.

{{whvid|Zip a Folder Step 8 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zip a Folder Step 8-preview Version 2.jpg|Zip a Folder Step 8 Version 2.jpg}} #* A person who receives a .zip file must double click on the folder to unzip the file. After completing this, they will be able to access all of the files in the original folder. === Zipping Files in Mac OS === # Create a new folder on your desktop or in a documents folder. # Name the folder according to the project or file subject. # Add the files you want to compress to that folder. # Select the folder using your mouse or track pad. # Right click on the folder. Scroll down and click on the option "Compress Folder Name." #* If you do not have a mouse with a right mouse button, press the "Control" button and the track pad bar at once. Scroll down with your track pad and click on the "Compress" option. # Wait for the folder to be compressed. Then, send or store the zipped file. Anyone who receives the file will need to double click on the .zip file to unzip and use it. == Related wikiHows == * [[Open a .Zip File Without Winzip|How to Open a .Zip File Without Winzip]] * [[Zip Files Together|How to Zip Files Together]] * [[Zip a File in Windows XP|How to Zip a File in Windows XP]] * [[Zip an MP3 File|How to Zip an MP3 File]] == Sources and Citations == * [http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/infopath-help/zip-or-unzip-a-file-HA001127690.aspx http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/infopath-help/zip-or-unzip-a-file-HA001127690.aspx] * [http://agsci.psu.edu/it/how-to/zip-or-unzip-a-file-or-folder-in-windows-7 http://agsci.psu.edu/it/how-to/zip-or-unzip-a-file-or-folder-in-windows-7] * [http://www.macinstruct.com/node/159 http://www.macinstruct.com/node/159] [[es:comprimir una carpeta]] [[it:Comprimere una Cartella]] [[pt:Zipar Uma Pasta]] [[de:Einen Ordner zippen]] [[ru:сжать (заархивировать) папку]] __METHODS__

A Photoshop Deluxe ([[Make a PSD File Using Photoshop (Beginner)|PSD]]) file is an image file that is capable of having multiple layers. Originally developed for the Adobe Photoshop software, the PSD format is now also used by many other programs with multi-layer image editing capabilities. You can use a compression utility called [[Unzip a File or Folder With Winzip|WinZip]] to zip a PSD file into a [[Open a .Zip File Without Winzip|compressed format]]. [[Category:File Manipulation]] == Steps == # Visit the WinZip website to download and install the WinZip compression utility on your computer system.

[[Image:Zip a PSD File Step 1 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Open the Start menu using the green button at the bottom-left of your screen and select "My Computer."

[[Image:Zip a PSD File Step 2 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Use the Windows Explorer window that opens up to go to the folder where

[[Image:Zip a PSD File Step 3 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Accept the WinZip terms of service.

[[Image:Zip a PSD File Step 4 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Create a new zip project by pressing the "New" button at the top.

[[Image:Zip a PSD File Step 5 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Pick the location where you want to save the zipped PSD file and assign a name for the new file.

[[Image:Zip a PSD File Step 6 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Hit the "OK" button. This will take you to the "Add" window.

[[Image:Zip a PSD File Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] # Use the file browser to find and select the PSD file that you want to zip.

[[Image:Zip a PSD File Step 8.jpg|center|550px]] # Zip the file by pressing the "Add" button. The zipped PSD file will appear in the folder that you had chosen with the filename that you had assigned.

[[Image:Zip a PSD File Step 9.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == *Many computers that are sold with the Windows operating system already have WinZip preinstalled by the manufacturer, so you may not have to download and install it yourself. *When you zip a PSD file its size becomes smaller. This makes it easier to share the file online or reduce the storage space required to save the file on your hard drive. You can use WinZip to decompress the file into its original size and PSD format later on. *WinZip is not just for compressing Photoshop Deluxe files. It can be used to compress many other file formats. == Warnings == *If you are using a version of Windows that was released before Windows XP you may have to open WinZip manually instead of using the "Add to Zip file" shortcut through Windows Explorer. == Related wikiHows == *[[Unzip a File or Folder With Winzip|How to Unzip a File or Folder With Winzip]] *[[Open Windows Explorer|How to Open Windows Explorer]] *[[Make a PSD File Using Photoshop (Beginner)|How to Make a PSD File Using Photoshop (Beginner)]] *[[Create a Simple Glass Button in Photoshop|How to Create a Simple Glass Button in Photoshop]] *[[Create Animated GIFs Using Photoshop|How to Create Animated GIFs Using Photoshop]] *[[Open a .Zip File Without Winzip|How to Open a .Zip File Without Winzip]] == Sources and Citations == *[https://www.nebraska.gov/NREC/real/realzipfiles.html https://www.nebraska.gov/NREC/real/realzipfiles.html] *[http://condor.depaul.edu/slytinen/instructions/zip.html http://condor.depaul.edu/slytinen/instructions/zip.html] *[http://www.winzip.com/win/en/index.htm http://www.winzip.com/win/en/index.htm] [[es:comprimir un archivo PSD]] [[ru:заархивировать PSD файл]]

A PowerPoint file can be compressed, or zipped, if the file size becomes too large to store on your computer or to send through email. In some cases, PowerPoint files can become large as a result of including multiple images or images with large pixel sizes in your presentation. In addition to zipping a PowerPoint file itself, there are also steps you can take to compress the images within your presentation. [[Category:PowerPoint Presentations]] == Steps == === Zip a PowerPoint File in Windows 7, XP, or Vista === # Navigate to the PowerPoint file that you need to zip, right-click it, place your cursor over "Send To" and select "Compressed (zipped) Folder".

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 1 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # A new window will appear and you need to click "Yes" to continue with the compression. This procedure will create a zipped version of your PowerPoint file.

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 2 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #* If you want to rename the zipped PowerPoint file, right-click on it, select "Rename," and type in a new name for the zipped file.

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 2Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] === Compress Images in PowerPoint 2002 and Later Versions === # Open your PowerPoint presentation.

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] # Navigate to a slide in your presentation where an image is present.

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] # Place your cursor over the image and right-click your mouse or just click the image (later versions of Power Point).

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] # Select "Format Picture".

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 6.jpg|center|550px]] # Click directly on the "Picture" tab and when the Format dialog box appears on your screen select "Compress", or just click "Compress Pictures" (later versions of Power Point).

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] # You can uncheck the box next to "Apply only to this picture" to apply the procedure to all pictures in the presentation.

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 8.jpg|center|550px]] # Select an option under the "Change resolution" section or "Target Output" (later versions of Power Point): choose the "Web and Screen" option if you plan on showing your PowerPoint presentation on a screen, choose the "Print" option if you are going to present the PowerPoint by distributing it on pieces of paper or choose E-mail option if you want to share your presentation. Also be sure that the box next to "Delete cropped areas of pictures" is checked.

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 9.jpg|center|550px]] # Click on the "OK" button to save your changes and compress your images.

[[Image:Zip a PowerPoint File Step 10.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == * Since a common pixel resolution for computer screens is 1024 by 768, you may need to compress any images larger than this in your PowerPoint presentation to reduce the size of your file. To view the pixel resolution of your computer screen, right-click anywhere on your desktop, select "Properties," and click on the "Settings" tab. Your resolution will be provided in the Screen Resolution section. == Related wikiHows == * [[Reduce Powerpoint File Size|How to Reduce Powerpoint File Size]] * [[Add Movie File to PowerPoint|How to Add Movie File to PowerPoint]] * [[Insert a PowerPoint to Google Page|How to Insert a PowerPoint to Google Page]] * [[Resize Numerous Picture Files Using MS PowerPoint|How to Resize Numerous Picture Files Using MS PowerPoint]] == Sources and Citations == * [http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows7/Compress-and-uncompress-files-zip-files http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows7/Compress-and-uncompress-files-zip-files] * [http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/powerpoint-help/reduce-the-size-of-your-powerpoint-files-HA001116882.aspx http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/powerpoint-help/reduce-the-size-of-your-powerpoint-files-HA001116882.aspx] [[es:comprimir un archivo de PowerPoint]] [[ru:сжать размер презентации PowerPoint]]

MPEG Audio Layer 3 (MP3) files are usually quite small in size because they are already compressed to remove any sounds that would not be audible on a noticeable level to the human ear. However, on certain occasions you may want to compress an MP3 further into Zip format, especially if you have a long song or speech that can make the size of the MP3 quite large. The most popular program you can use to zip an MP3 file is WinZip, a file compression utility developed by Microsoft. [[Category:File Manipulation]] == Steps == # Download the WinZip utility from the official WinZip website and install it on your computer.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 1 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Go to "My Computer" from the Start menu to open Windows Explorer.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 2 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Browse to the folder containing the MP3 file that you want to zip.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 3 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Right-click on the MP3 file's name.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 4 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Mouse-over "Zip Program" or "Send to" in the pop-up menu (you should see 1 of the 2 options depending on which version of Windows you are using).

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 5 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Click on "Add to Zip file." The MP3 will be zipped and the new zipped file will be added in the same folder containing the original MP3.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 6 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] === Compressing Through WinZip === # Run the WinZip utility by selecting it from the Programs list in the Start menu.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 7 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Agree to the terms and conditions if prompted to do so at startup.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 8 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Press the "New" button in the top-left corner. This will pop up the "New Archive" window.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 9 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Use the file browser box to select the folder where you want to store the zipped file.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 10 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Type the name you want to give to the new file in the "File Name" textbox.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 11 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Press the "OK" button. The "Add" window will appear automatically.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 12 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Select the MP3 file that you want to compress. You can go to the file and select it using the file browser.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 13 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Press the "Add" button. The MP3 file that you had selected will be zipped and the new zipped file will be saved in the folder that you had assigned in the New Archive window.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 14 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Close WinZip after you are done using it by clicking on the cross sign in the top-right corner.

[[Image:Zip an MP3 File Step 15 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == * WinZip may already be preinstalled in some computers. * Other utility programs that you can use to zip an MP3 file include PentaZip, PowerArchiver and PKZip. Their method of use for converting files to Zip format is very similar to that of WinZip. * Select multiple files at once in the file browser by pressing down the Control (Ctrl) key on your keyboard and clicking on all the files that you want to select. == Related wikiHows == *[[Open a .Zip File Without Winzip|How to Open a .Zip File Without Winzip]] *[[Convert Flac to MP3|How to Convert Flac to MP3]] *[[Copy a File and Ignore Cyclic Redundancy Check Errors|How to Copy a File and Ignore Cyclic Redundancy Check Errors]] *[[Use 7Zip to Create Multiple Compressed Folders in One Go|How to Use 7Zip to Create Multiple Compressed Folders in One Go]] == Sources and Citations == * [http://www.makeuseof.com/tag/technology-explained-what-is-mp3-what-is-its-origins/ http://www.makeuseof.com/tag/technology-explained-what-is-mp3-what-is-its-origins/] * [http://www.winzip.com/aboutzip.htm http://www.winzip.com/aboutzip.htm] * [http://condor.depaul.edu/slytinen/instructions/zip.html http://condor.depaul.edu/slytinen/instructions/zip.html] * [http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/infopath-help/zip-or-unzip-a-file-HA001127690.aspx http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/infopath-help/zip-or-unzip-a-file-HA001127690.aspx] [[es:comprimir un archivo MP3]] [[ru:сжимать MP3 файлы]]

page.title: Zip and Unzip Files with Peazip

revision.comment: Fixing misspellings via the Spellchecker tool
revision.text:
Zip is a common compressed archive file format: an archive file is meant to combine multiple files together for easier management i.e. backup, sharing through mail or cloud or any other network service, etc. File compression basically uses statistical models to map the original data to a smaller output, which allows both to spare storage for backup and save upload and download bandwidth (and time) for sharing.

Over time, various archive file types emerged, introducing unique features to distinguish them from competitors, as stronger compression ratio, ability to split the output archive to met some constrains (i.e. mail attachment limit), error detection and correction, and encryption in order to enforce privacy if the file is stolen, or passed through public or third party controlled channels, i.e. mail server, or remote storage service. This brought users more choice and more features, but also the need for dedicated archive manager applications to fully use the potential of different file formats, either for creating own archives, and for extracting archives received or downloaded. [[Category:Software]] == Steps == #

PeaZip is a freeware cross-platform archive manager that provides a single GUI for Open Source technologies ([[Archive Using 7zip|7-Zip]], FreeArc, PAQ, UPX...) on Windows, Linux, and BSD. The file manager allows both to select files and folders to be archived as Zip files (or other formats), and to select archives to be unzipped. Alternatively, file selection can be performed with PeaZip system's context menu entries (not featured in PeaZip Portable version) or simply dragging and dropping files from / to the program.

[[Image:Zip and Unzip Files with Peazip Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] #

Archive creation can be started dragging files on the application, or with "Add" button in program's tool bar. The archive creation interface prompts by default creation of a Zip file, but the file format can be customized, as well as compression ratio (from faster to better) and other miscellaneous options, including encryption. PeaZip relies on optimized Deflate algorithm for compressing in Zip format, that usually compress 5-10% better than standard Deflate but keeping compatibility with other Zip utilities. 7Z format gives better compression ratio, but is slower than Zip. As quite unique feature for archive management software, PeaZip supports two factor authentication (password plus key file), random password generation, and features an integrated encrypted password manager. "Advanced" tab features more fine-grained options, "Console" tab transform the task in a command line i.e. for use in scripts or for study purpose, "Schedule" tab allows to transform the interactive task in a scheduled one, i.e. for setting up a backup.

[[Image:Zip and Unzip Files with Peazip Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] #

Archive extraction can be started from system context menu, or dragging compressed files on the application, or with "Extract" button in program's tool bar. It can handle multiple archives even of mixed types at once, or selective extraction of content from a single archive. Over 170 types of archives are supported: classic ZIP files and its variants, new WinZip's ZIPX file format, RAR files, old ACE archives, Microsoft's CAB and WIM files, Apple's DMG packages, ISO and UDF disk images, and many more.

[[Image:Zip and Unzip Files with Peazip Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == *PeaZip Portable is available for all supported platforms, and does not require installation. It is useful to be deployed on a removable media or over a network, or when lacking of rights for installing software on the target machine *The software features secure deletion to permanently remove files and archives after the use *As an option, history of recently viewed directories and archives can be deleted and turned off == Warnings == *Zip format can be read by any archive manager utility, and most systems (i.e. Windows XP and newer) features basic tools for Unzip. Using archive formats different than Zip may bring various additional features resulting in several benefits, but the receiver of the file may lack the tools to handle it. == Things You'll Need == **[http://peazip.sourceforge.net/ PeaZip]

revision.text:
This is like meditation or hypnosis in a sense, except you can do this comfortably for large amounts of time without suffering from boredom. This is a good way to relax while coming up with constructive ideas. Leave zoning out for when you have free time; it isn't something to practice during work or school hours. [[Category:Relaxation Techniques]] == Steps == #Stop conversations with other people.

[[Image:Zone Out Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] # Close your eyes if you want to.

[[Image:Zone Out Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Sit or lie down.

[[Image:Zone Out Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] #Pick a thought that is calming or something that requires quite a bit of thinking, but is not stressful. For example, how you are going to plan your garden, or going to the beach.

[[Image:Zone Out Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] #Start thinking about it and keep thinking. Keep your muscles relaxed - being tense can hinder the progress. #Vision leads to imagination. If you are trying to zone out per-say in a really boring meeting, find one, JUST ONE, object and STARE at it, (Coffee mug, pencil, window) don't move or think about anything in particular, just...stare. #Lose your focus. Other than blinking, don't move your eyes, if you really want to be "inside your imagination," allow your vision to lose focus. # Pin-pointed vision. There are people that can realize they are zoning out, while doing so, when their vision is coming to a pin-point, all is black except for that little pin-point. If you even think about moving your eyes, the pin-point widens and you regain your full vision again. == Tips == *Where you are can affect this. For example, it would be hard to do this at a crowded birthday party. *Use music only if it works for you; some people find it helps them zone out, but others end up focusing on the lyrics or beats. *You will be able to tell when you have zoned out because your surroundings seem to go into the background and you are living in your thoughts The best way I can describe it is like when you are in a dream and you can influence it you just feel relaxed and at peace with everything. If you feel your self slipping off to sleep don't stop it for me that's saying you are now relaxed. *It may not be a good idea to disconnect from your surroundings, but this can be very calming. == Warnings == *Never zone out when driving or operating dangerous machinery, or if your attention is needed. *Zoning out is not a good idea in a class where your teacher may notice or you need to take notes or do work. *If you are really disconnected from your surroundings you may be at risk of being embarrassed when you are "awakened." *Don't zone out at work. *Try not to stare at one spot for too long. You may notice that subject begin to "smoke". == Things You'll Need == *A mind *A few good ideas to think about. *A place where you can have privacy and be alone. == Related wikiHows == *[[Do Concentration Meditation|How to Do Concentration Meditation]] *[[Do Awareness Meditation|How to Do Awareness Meditation]] *[[Mentally Drift|How to Mentally Drift]] *[[Relax in the Comfort of Your Living Room|How to Relax in the Comfort of Your Living Room]] *[[Devote a Day to Relaxing and Pampering Yourself at Home|How to Devote a Day to Relaxing and Pampering Yourself at Home]]

page.title: Zone Out when a Teacher Is Talking to You and Not Get Caught

revision.comment: reordering tips and warnings based on votes
revision.text:
Ok, so you have this really boring teacher, and she always brings you into the hall, or gets mad, and lectures you, and stuff. Are you tired of it? Well, here's a perfect solution! This can be used with bosses, or teachers, or even parents and principals! [[Category:Dealing with Teachers]] == Steps == #Listen for key words. If your teacher has words he or she frequently uses, like, "Got it?!" or "Understand?!" This is good.

[[Image:Accept Your Boyfriend's Friends Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Wait for words that expect a response (Like "ok?") and say, "Yes madam, or "Ok Sir". But be careful, your teacher might be saying "Do you think that's okay?" and you would be caught, so do this carefully.

[[Image:Avoid Being Noticed in School Step 9.jpg|center|550px]] #Think about a song you like in your "subconscious", and allow your mind to wander into other thoughts. Just keep listening for those words.

[[Image:Be a Good Friend (for Girls) Step 12.jpg|center|550px]] #If your teacher yells at you, "ARE YOU LISTENING TO ME?!!?" and wakes you up, so to speak, just say "yes, I didn't think I was supposed to answer, like a rhetorical question...Sorry."

[[Image:Avoid Being Noticed in School Step 6.jpg|center|550px]] #Try to go into a self-induced trance, and turn all sound that goes through the state of mind your in, sub, or logical, into vision, like colours, it’s called synesthesia, and it's hard to self-induce. But it's awesome!

[[Image:Be a Good Friend (for Girls) Step 14.jpg|center|550px]] #Make sure you are still using about 12-17% brainpower of the state you're in, to stay in touch with the real world, to keep the other half of your mind listening. Think of it as waking up to an alarm clock, but not a pet jumping on to your bed to cuddle...

[[Image:Avoid Getting Detentions Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] #Don't get too cocky, check in on the real world every so often, and see if the conversation was headed where you thought, so you can answer at least some of the questions your teacher might ask at the end of what to you was a "great talk".

[[Image:Survive In a Boarding School Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] #Try this short periods at a time a then start to go longer periods when you think you have got the hang of it.

[[Image:Accept Your Boyfriend's Friends Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == *Don't stare at her/him. They'll notice your tactics. *Another tactic is mind-rambling. You think of one topic, and then you go off on another tangent, until you think of two things that seem to have no relation at all, except for the tangent your twisted, sadistic mind came up with. *Don't say "Wait, what were you saying?" After they ask you something, they will probably get angry that you were not listening. == Warnings == *Don't let your eyes droop, and don't fall asleep, try and think of things that are somewhat interesting, to keep you awake. *Keep zoning out, and you might miss something very important like, '''There is no school tomorrow''' *Don't let them catch you, know what they say, and consider all the possibilities. You don't want to look out only for a select few things because your teacher might say something important and you'll miss it. *Do not try this if you might get fired! == Things You'll Need == *A friend to practice the activities described above. *A multi-tasking ability == Related wikiHows == *[[Avoid Getting Detentions|How to Avoid Getting Detentions]] *[[Impress Your Teachers|How to Impress Your Teachers]] *[[Lie|How to Lie]] *[[Pass Notes in Class|How to Pass Notes in Class]]

page.title: Zoom In or Out of a Microsoft Word Document

revision.text:
Sometimes, you need to really get close to what you are doing in a software program. This article helps you with MS Word. [[Category:Microsoft Word]] == Steps == # Open up Microsoft Word to your document you'd like to zoom into.

[[Image:Zoom In or Out of a Microsoft Word Document Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] # Scroll to the area you'd like to better see.

[[Image:Zoom In or Out of a Microsoft Word Document Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Understand that there are multiple ways to find and select the zoom-in/out buttons. #* There are buttons within the Menu toolbar from the top of your screen.

[[Image:Zoom In or Out of a Microsoft Word Document Step 3Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] #* There is a button in the Standard toolbar of Microsoft Word, that will allow you to Zoom-into our out-of your document.

[[Image:Zoom In or Out of a Microsoft Word Document Step 3Bullet2.jpg|center|550px]] # Figure out which way is easiest to try and zoom in/out of your document. #* Select the View menu bar at the top of the screen, and select Zoom. Select your Zoom level.

[[Image:Zoom In or Out of a Microsoft Word Document Step 4Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] #** A larger number than your initial zoom level signifies a zoom-in of a preferred amount. A smaller number than your initial zoom level signifies a zoom-out of a preferred amount. #** You can also choose to provide a Customized zoom level, by clicking the "Percent" drop-down box and typing your own predefined zoom level %. #* Look for the zoom drop-down from the Standard toolbar. Click the drop-down option, and select your zoom level.

[[Image:Zoom In or Out of a Microsoft Word Document Step 4Bullet2.jpg|center|550px]] #** You can also click this same box and type your own customized zoom-level number. #** No need to type the percent sign in either of these styles. == Video == {{Video:Zoom In or Out of a Microsoft Word Document|}} == Tips == *These zoom steps are meant for users of Word 2003. Since 2007 and 2010 are more graphical oriented, there are several other methods to obtain the zoom options stated in this article. Refer to your Microsoft Word 2007 or 2010 Help documents for information on how to zoom into or out of your document. Use the search term "zoom into a document" == Things You'll Need == *Microsoft Word document *Microsoft Word program *computer mouse and keyboard == Related wikiHows == *[[Use Microsoft Office Word 2007|How to Use Microsoft Office Word 2007]] *[[Fill Out Paper Forms with MS Word|How to Fill Out Paper Forms with MS Word]] *[[Make a Word Document Your Background|How to Make a Word Document Your Background]] *[[Create a Brochure in Microsoft Word 2007|How to Create a Brochure in Microsoft Word 2007]]

page.title: Zoom In or Out on an iPhone or iPod Touch

revision.text:
One of the most powerful features of an iOS device like an iPhone, iPod Touch or iPad is the ability to zoom into things like maps, photos and web pages. This handy guide helps explain the basics behind bringing out enhanced detail on your touch screen device. [[Category:IPod Touch]] [[Category:IPhone]] == Steps == #While using a zoom-friendly application (more common instances are web pages, email messages and photos), place your thumb and pointer finger at opposing points of the screen as if preparing to pinch a cheek.

[[Image:Zoom In or Out on an iPhone or iPod Touch Step 1 Version 4.jpg|center|550px]] #Gently move your fingers away from each other. Note that the speed at which your fingers are spread will influence the rate of zoom.

[[Image:Zoom In or Out on an iPhone or iPod Touch Step 2 Version 4.jpg|center|550px]] #To zoom back out, reverse the motion and gently "pinch" your fingers towards each other while keeping contact with the screen.

[[Image:Zoom In or Out on an iPhone or iPod Touch Step 3 Version 4.jpg|center|550px]] == Video == {{Video:Zoom In or Out on an iPhone or iPod Touch|}} == Tips == *An alternate method is to simply double-tap on an image or object you would like to zoom into or out of. Though the zoom distance is pre-set, this can often be a handy shortcut for quickly glancing at something in detail, and can sometimes be repeated to zoom deeper into high-detail objects like maps. *Though this guide applies specifically to iOS devices, the action will work on nearly any modern multi-touch screen. *It can help to use your fingernail and fingertip to add precision and avoid obscuring details of what you'd like to zoom in on. *While zoomed in, some applications will allow you to rotate an object (a map or a picture, for instance) by simply "rotating" your fingers around the same center point you were zooming in an out from. == Things You'll Need == *iPhone, iPod Touch, or iPad *fingers == Related wikiHows == *[[Decide Between an iPhone and an iPod Touch|How to Decide Between an iPhone and an iPod Touch]] *[[Use the iPod Touch|How to Use the iPod Touch]] *[[Hard Reset an iPhone|How to Hard Reset an iPhone]] *[[Put Music and Videos on Your iPhone|How to Put Music and Videos on Your iPhone]] *[[Use Full Screen Browsing on an iPhone|How to Use Full Screen Browsing on an iPhone]] *[[Use Control Center on iOS|How to Use Control Center on iOS]] *[[Magnify Your iOS Device with Accessibility Zooming|How to Magnify Your iOS Device with Accessibility Zooming]] [[es:acercar o alejar la cámara de un iPhone o iPod touch]] [[ru:увеличить или уменьшить масштаб на iPhone или iPod Touch]]

revision.text: #REDIRECT [[Zoom In or Out on an iPhone or iPod Touch]]

[[Zoom in on a PC|Zooming in]] and out on a PC is very simple. Here are several methods to do so! [[Category:Windows]] == Steps == ===In a Browser=== #In any browser, you can go to View >> Zoom Out to de-magnify what's present on the screen.

{{whvid|Zoom Out on a PC Step 1 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom Out on a PC Step 1-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom Out on a PC Step 1.jpg}} ===Using the Ctrl Key=== #Press and hold the ctrl key; then scroll down with your mouse's scroll wheel or laptop's trackpad to zoom out.

{{whvid|Zoom Out on a PC Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom Out on a PC Step 2-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom Out on a PC Step 2 Version 2.jpg}} #Alternatively, press and hold the ctrl key, then press - to zoom out.

{{whvid|Zoom Out on a PC Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom Out on a PC Step 3-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom Out on a PC Step 3 Version 2.jpg}} #Press ctrl and then the "0" (zero) key to return the screen to its original/normal magnification.

{{whvid|Zoom Out on a PC Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom Out on a PC Step 4-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom Out on a PC Step 4.jpg}} ===Using Magnifier=== #PCs have an accessibility tool called Magnifier that you can hold over parts of the screen for readability and ease of usage. You can set the zoom setting to be lower than 100% to set up a De-Magnifier.

{{whvid|Zoom Out on a PC Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom Out on a PC Step 5-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom Out on a PC Step 5.jpg}} #Launch the tool by going to Start >> Programs >> Accessories >> Accessibility >> Magnifier. Click on the magnifying class icon to manage its settings, and set the zoom level to a number lower than 100%.

{{whvid|Zoom Out on a PC Step 6 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom Out on a PC Step 6-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom Out on a PC Step 6.jpg}} #*Setting Magnifier to "Full Screen" mode magnifies your entire screen. #*Setting Magnifier to "Lens" mode creates an magnified area that follows your mouse pointer, much like a real magnifying glass. #*In that menu, there is also an option to turn off the Magnifier. == Related wikiHows == *[[Zoom With a Web Browser|How to Zoom With a Web Browser]] *[[Zoom out in Adobe Illustrator|How to Zoom out in Adobe Illustrator]] *[[Zoom in on a Photo in Microsoft Paint|How to Zoom in on a Photo in Microsoft Paint]] *[[Zoom in Internet Explorer|How to Zoom in Internet Explorer]] *[[Make the Print Larger on a Computer Screen|How to Make the Print Larger on a Computer Screen]] == Sources and Citations == *[http://www.microsoft.com/athome/setup/magnify.aspx#fbid=FcEKLBoB_2I Magnify your computer screen: 6 ways to make it easier to see] [[es:alejar la vista en una PC]] [[it:Usare la Funzionalità Zoom Indietro su Computer]] [[pt:Diminuir o Zoom num PC]] [[de:An einem PC hinauszoomen]] [[zh:在个人电脑上缩小画面]] [[ru:уменьшить изображение на экране компьютера]] [[fr:faire un zoom arrière sur un PC]]

page.title: Zoom PPT Slides in and Out on Android Devices

revision.text:
Can't read the content of a Presentation slide clearly on your Android gadget ? Zoom it in. What? Your Android Office app doesn't support slide zoom feature ? Now Kingsoft's upgraded Office for Android Free 5.3.1 has added a key feature that displays live effects when adjusting a slide's size. This new feature enables you to zoom PPT slides in and out freely to better edit and view. Before installing, you have the privilege to know that Kingsoft Office for Android is perfectly compatible with Microsoft Office, which means you can use this freeware to create, view, edit and save files in nearly all the Microsoft Office formats. [[Category:Android Applications]] == Steps == # Install '''Kingsoft Office For Android Free 5.9.1'''[http://www.kingsoftstore.com/software/office-for-android] on your Android cell phones or tablets.

[[Image:Zoom PPT Slides in and Out on Android Devices Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] # Make sure you click on "Accept" on the App permission.

[[Image:Zoom PPT Slides in and Out on Android Devices Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Open an existing PowerPoint Presentation document with the app you've just installed, or simply create a blank one.

[[Image:Zoom PPT Slides in and Out on Android Devices Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] # Pinch out with two fingers on the currently editing slide. Its size becomes magnified/larger in live effects.

[[Image:Zoom PPT Slides in and Out on Android Devices Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] # Pinch in with two fingers on the currently editing slide. Its size becomes minified/smaller in live effects.

[[Image:Zoom PPT Slides in and Out on Android Devices Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] == Related wikiHows == * [[Print from an Android Phone or Tablet|How to Print from an Android Phone or Tablet]] * [[Make a PowerPoint Presentation That Includes Audio and Video Files|How to Make a PowerPoint Presentation That Includes Audio and Video Files]] * [[Use Google Cloud Print from Your Android|How to Use Google Cloud Print from Your Android]]

page.title: Zoom Pages of Worksheet in Kingsoft Office Spreadsheets 2013

revision.text:
In Spreadsheets 2013, you can set the zoom scaling when you print the worksheet. If the sheet is too small, you can increase its percentage. If the sheet is too large, you can decrease its percentage to fit it in one page. [[Category:Word Processors]] == Steps == #Click the Page Zoom icon in the Layout tab and the Page Setup dialogue box will open. Select the Page tab.

[[Image:Zoom Pages of Worksheet in Kingsoft Office Spreadsheets 2013 Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] #You can adjust the print scaling in the Scaling section. Enter the proportion you want to zoom the worksheet in the Adjust to enter box. Kingsoft Spreadsheets supports worksheet zoom from 10% to 400%.

[[Image:Zoom Pages of Worksheet in Kingsoft Office Spreadsheets 2013 Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Enter the number of page that you want the worksheet to fit to in the Fit to enter box.

[[Image:Zoom Pages of Worksheet in Kingsoft Office Spreadsheets 2013 Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] #Enter the width of the worksheet in the wide by enter box.

[[Image:Zoom Pages of Worksheet in Kingsoft Office Spreadsheets 2013 Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == *When you select Adjust to, the system will automatically ignore the manually created breaks. Change the values in the Adjust to enter box, the spreadsheet will then be printed according to your needs. == Related wikiHows == *[[Mail Merge Address Labels Using Excel and Word|How to Mail Merge Address Labels Using Excel and Word]] *[[Convert Excel to Word|How to Convert Excel to Word]] *[[Write a Simple Macro in Microsoft Excel|How to Write a Simple Macro in Microsoft Excel]] *[[Send Workbook As Email in Kingsoft Spreadsheets 2013|How to Send Workbook As Email in Kingsoft Spreadsheets 2013]] *[[Change Worksheet Properties in Kingsoft Spreadsheets 2013|How to Change Worksheet Properties in Kingsoft Spreadsheets 2013]] == Sources and Citations == *Original source of article -http://help.ksosoft.com/spreadsheets/630-how-to-zoom-pages-of-worksheet-in-spreadsheets-2013.html#.U1ouWGC_kdU - shared with permission

Internet accessibility is important even if you are not suffering a visual impairment. Web pages should be designed with this in mind. Early web browsers were able to increase text size but not pictures or much dynamic content. Modern web browsers recognize this accessibility need and offer features to increase the size of text and pictures. [[Category:Internet Browsers]] == Steps == === PC === # Get a browser that supports zooming such as [[Use-Mozilla-Firefox|Firefox]] or [[Use-Opera|Opera]].

[[Image:Zoom With a Web Browser Step 1 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Click to ''View'' then ''Zoom'' then ''Zoom Text Only'' if you wish.

[[Image:Zoom With a Web Browser Step 2 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Press ''Ctrl'' and + to zoom in.

[[Image:Zoom With a Web Browser Step 3 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Press ''Ctrl'' and - to zoom out.

[[Image:Zoom With a Web Browser Step 4 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Press ''Ctrl'' and 0 to restore the original size.

[[Image:Zoom With a Web Browser Step 5 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] === Macintosh === # Use the "Command" key instead of "Ctrl". Alt is Command on some keyboards. [[Image:462790 6.jpg|center|416px]] == Video == {{Video:Zoom With a Web Browser|This video only highlights zooming on the FireFox browser. }} == Tips == *This won't change the size of a page you subsequently print. *This won't change the size of a page or picture you subsequently save. == Related wikiHows == *[[Optimize Your Netbook|How to Optimize Your Netbook]] *[[Choose an Internet Browser|How to Choose an Internet Browser]] *[[Use Tabbed Browsing|How to Use Tabbed Browsing]] [[es:Aumentar el tamaño del texto en el navegador]] *[[Zoom Out on a PC|How to Zoom Out on a PC]] *[[Zoom in on a PC|How to Zoom in on a PC]] __methods__ [[ru:увеличить масштаб страницы браузера]]

page.title: Zoom Your Facebook Profile Picture Thumbnail

revision.text:
Some of you already know how to edit your thumbnail of your Facebook profile picture, but it has a very big difference about this technique. Some of you may crop your profile picture just to have a thumbnail showing your face but it affects the likes and comments. [[Category:Facebook Profiles]] == Steps == #First go to your Profile.

[[Image:Zoom Your Facebook Profile Picture Thumbnail Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] #Hover your mouse to your display picture and click Update Profile Picture.

[[Image:Zoom Your Facebook Profile Picture Thumbnail Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Choose Edit Thumbnail and this will come up.

[[Image:Zoom Your Facebook Profile Picture Thumbnail Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] #Right click your thumbnail and pick inspect element.

[[Image:Zoom Your Facebook Profile Picture Thumbnail Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] #Then the developer tools will come up. Find the width and height below.

[[Image:Zoom Your Facebook Profile Picture Thumbnail Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] #Double click the part where the width and height is in the same line and then edit the width and height. After changing the value of width and height, press Enter.

[[Image:Zoom Your Facebook Profile Picture Thumbnail Step 6.jpg|center|550px]] #And then close the developer tools by pressing F12 on the keyboard. There you have it, click Save to save the changes .This technique is very simple.

[[Image:Zoom Your Facebook Profile Picture Thumbnail Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] #Just click your display picture to see if the comments and likes are still there.

[[Image:Zoom Your Facebook Profile Picture Thumbnail Step 8.jpg|center|550px]]

page.title: Zoom a Document in Kingsoft Office Writer 2013

revision.comment: editing article via New Article Boost feature
revision.text:
To zoom a document in Writer 2013, the options are as follows: [[Category:Word Processors]] == Steps == # [[Image:Zoom options.png|right|180px]]Zoom a document to 100% percent. Click the 100% icon in the View tab, the document will then be displayed in accordance with the ratio of 100%. # [[Image:Zoom document in writer 2013.png|right|179px]]Zoom a document to other levels. Alternatively, you can click the Zoom icon to open the Zoom dialogue box and enter the proportion you prefer. Click the OK button to complete the operation. # Zoom a document to page width. Click the Page Width icon in the View tab and the page width of the document will be zoomed to the width of the window. # Zoom a document to display one/two pages in window. In the View tab, click the One Page icon and the current document will be displayed in one page in the window. Click the Two Pages icon and two pages of the current document fits in the window.
== Related wikiHows == * [[Print a Document Background Color in PDF Using Kingsoft Writer 2013|How to Print a Document Background Color in PDF Using Kingsoft Writer 2013]] * [[Convert DOCX Format Document to PDF Using Kingsoft Office 2013|How to Convert DOCX Format Document to PDF Using Kingsoft Office 2013]] * [[Use Task Window in Kingsoft Office Writer 2013|How to Use Task Window in Kingsoft Office Writer 2013]] * [[Make Slash Table Header in Kingsoft Office Writer 2013|How to Make Slash Table Header in Kingsoft Office Writer 2013]]

page.title: Zoom a Web Page to Enlarge the Words

revision.text:
Enlarging the words displayed on your web browser can help in improving how visible and legible the contents of a web page are. The process is similar across different platforms and web browsers, so it is a convenient trick. To learn how to enlarge words of a web page, see step 1. [[Category:Basic Computer Skills]] == Steps == #Locate the plus (+) and minus (-) buttons on your computer’s keyboard. They are typically at the end of the row of numbers just below F10 or at the rightmost side of the numeric keypad.

[[Image:Zoom a Web Page to Enlarge the Words Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] #Locate the CTRL key (for Windows) or the CMD key (for Mac). #*There are two CTRL keys for Windows, located at the bottom row edges of the alphanumeric keypads; both are under the SHIFT keys.

[[Image:Zoom a Web Page to Enlarge the Words Step 2Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] #*There are also two CMD keys for Mac; both are beside the Spacebar.

[[Image:Zoom a Web Page to Enlarge the Words Step 2Bullet2.jpg|center|550px]] #Launch your preferred web browser. Do this by double-clicking the browser’s icon on the desktop, in your taskbar or dock, or in your programs list.

[[Image:Zoom a Web Page to Enlarge the Words Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] #Head to a web page. Go to a website whose contents you want to enlarge for better viewing. Do this by typing in the website’s URL in the address bar at the top of the browser.

[[Image:Zoom a Web Page to Enlarge the Words Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] #Enlarge the words. Once on the page, press and hold the CTRL or CMD then press the plus (+) key. The words and images will be magnified.

[[Image:Zoom a Web Page to Enlarge the Words Step 5.jpg|center|550px]] #* Press + again while still holding the CMD or CTRL button to enlarge the words further. == Tips == * To zoom out, press the minus (-) key instead of the plus (+) key while holding the CTRL or CMD keys. [[es:ampliar una página web para agrandar las palabras]] [[it:Zoomare una Pagina Web per Ingrandirne il Contenuto]] [[pt:Dar Zoom em uma Página da Web para Ampliar as Palavras]] [[ru:масштабировать веб страницу, чтобы увеличить текст]]

IMovie allows users to use a zoom feature with any photo, still frame video shot, or video clip that has been imported into your iMovie project. The act of zooming in and out and panning back and forth over a photo, still frame video shot, or video is called the "Ken Burns Effect" and is how the effect buttons are designated within the iMovie program. Ken Burns is a noted film documentarian that developed this particular zoom and pan technique. [[Category:IMovie]] == Steps == # Open your iMovie program and select the iMovie project you wish to add the zoom effect to.

[[Image:Zoom iMovie Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] # Click on the video clip you are applying the zoom effect to within the event browser window in the upper middle portion of the iMovie project screen. This will make the selected clip show up in the window to the right of the video clip event browser. Verify you have selected the appropriate video clip to apply the zoom effect to.

[[Image:Zoom iMovie Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] # Click on the "Crop" button located on the middle pane separating the top project workspace from the bottom. This button is designated by a square with the 2 lines of the square that create the corners overlapping each other. This button will bring up "Fit," "Crop," and "Ken Burns" video editing effects onto the selected video clip within the editing viewer.

[[Image:Zoom iMovie Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] # Select the "Ken Burns" button located at the upper middle portion of the video editing screen. This will bring up a green rectangle and a red rectangle.

[[Image:Zoom iMovie Step 4.jpg|center|550px]] # Place the rectangles according to where you want the zoom effect to begin and where you want the effect to end. #* Place the green rectangle over the image area you want the effect to zoom in on when the clip starts; place the red rectangle over the area you want the zoom effect to end on. For example, the green rectangle can be focused on a smaller area, which will create a zoomed in effect, and the red rectangle can be placed in a larger aspect of the clip to zoom out. You can move these rectangles around by clicking and dragging each around to the specific spot you need the zoom effect to take place.

[[Image:Zoom iMovie Step 5Bullet1.jpg|center|550px]] #* Also, resize the rectangles accordingly by dragging the corners of each rectangle back and forth, resizing the image area.

[[Image:Zoom iMovie Step 5Bullet2.jpg|center|550px]] #* Selecting the double arrow button at the bottom of the video editing screen will make the green and red rectangles swap positions.

[[Image:Zoom iMovie Step 5Bullet3.jpg|center|550px]] # Preview the Ken Burns effect you have just created by clicking on the "Play" button in the video viewer/editor window. This button is designated by the play symbol (sideways triangle). Adjust the rectangles to get the effect exactly how you want.

[[Image:Zoom iMovie Step 6.jpg|center|550px]] # Click on the "Done" button once you have modified the effect to its desired position to apply the effects you have just created.

[[Image:Zoom iMovie Step 7.jpg|center|550px]] == Video == {{Video:Zoom iMovie|}} == Tips == *In older versions of the iMovie program, the Ken Burns effect is only applicable to still frame video and photos. == Related wikiHows == *[[Embed a Track on an iMovie HD|How to Embed a Track on an iMovie HD]] *[[Add Fade in iMovie|How to Add Fade in iMovie]] *[[Create a Project in iMovie 08|How to Create a Project in iMovie 08]] *[[Add Garageband to iMovie|How to Add Garageband to iMovie]] == Sources and Citations == *[https://discussions.apple.com/message/13071024?messageID=13071024 https://discussions.apple.com/message/13071024?messageID=13071024] [[es:hacer zoom en iMovie]] [[it:Usare lo Zoom su iMovie]] [[pt:Dar Zoom no iMovie]]

Minecraft is a game where you can build your own world using Lego style blocks and tools. In order to zoom in or out while playing, you will need to use a Minecraft mod. A mod - or modification - allows you to change the original game content in order to manipulate what you need. Zooming in Minecraft isn’t a native feature, and therefore will need to enable mods. [[Category:Minecraft]] == Steps == === Download the OptiFine Mod === #Head to the Minecraft Mod forums: http://www.minecraftforum.net/forum/51-minecraft-mods/.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 1 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Search for the OptiFine mod. Use the search bar in the top right of the page.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 2 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #*You can also click http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/249637-174-optifine-hd-d1-fps-boost-hd-textures-aa-af-and-much-more/page__hl__%20optifine #Access the thread. Do so by clicking on it.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 3 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Head to the first page of the thread. Click the (<<) button in the page count to the left of the thread.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 4 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Scroll down until you see "Download" and click it. You should then end up with a .zip file.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 5 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] === Download Magic Launcher === #Download Magic Launcher. You'll find it in the Minecraft forums: http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/939149-launcher-magic-launcher-125-mods-options-profiles-news/.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 6 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Choose an installer. Scroll down and click the installer suited for your OS.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 7 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Note that if you have Forge installed, you cannot download Magic Launcher. You can just install this mod (the Forge method).

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 8 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] === Set Up Your Mod Folder === #Head to your Minecraft folder. For Windows, it’s located at C:/Users/(username)/AppData/Roaming/minecraft. To easily access the folder, go to "Start," type “Minecraft” on the search bar, and right-click. Then go to "Properties" and click “Open folder location.” For Mac it’s at /Users/(username)/Library/Application Support/minecraft/.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 9 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Make a new folder to put your mod in. Name it what you want. Paste the .zip file you downloaded for the OptiFine mod.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 10 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] === Launch Magic Launcher and Configure It === #Run the .'''exe file for Magic Launcher. Here you’ll see the main screen.'''

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 11 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Click the "Setup" button.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 12 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Click “New” and name it Optifine Minecraft. Then click “Okay.”

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 13 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Click the "Add" button. It is located in the setup screen.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 14 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Choose the mod folder you just created. Click “Open.'''”'''

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 15 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Tick the box beside OptiFine.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 16 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Click “Okay.'''”'''

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 17 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] === Play Minecraft === #Log into the game. Play like you normally would.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 18 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Press Ctrl. This will allow you to zoom in as needed.

[[Image:Zoom in Minecraft Step 19 Version 2.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == *You can use the same procedure when applied to other mods using Magic Launcher. == Sources and Citations == *http://www.minecraftforum.net/forum/51-minecraft-mods/ *http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/249637-174-optifine-hd-d1-fps-boost-hd-textures-aa-af-and-much-more/page__hl__%20optifine *http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/939149-launcher-magic-launcher-125-mods-options-profiles-news/ __PARTS__ [[fr:zoomer dans Minecraft]] [[es:hacer zoom en Minecraft]]

revision.text:
The font size in PDF is fixed. But flip ebook made from eFlip Standard is intended to offer people the convenient and amazing reading experience. To give each readers a perfect size, we can add a zoom in and out button on book, so that people can adjust the page size as they like. [[Category:Flipbook Software]] == Steps == #Run eFlip Standard software and import file to get the flip page effect;

[[Image:Zoom in and Out Flip eBook Pages with Eflip Standard Step 1.jpg|center|550px]] #Select Neat template and enable show zoom feature by choosing "Yes". Then press "Apply Change" icon to show the button on book;

[[Image:Zoom in and Out Flip eBook Pages with Eflip Standard Step 2.jpg|center|550px]] #Click the zoom button to adjust page size according you need.

[[Image:Zoom in and Out Flip eBook Pages with Eflip Standard Step 3.jpg|center|550px]] == Tips == *More functional buttons you can use: *Win more readers: enable show share or social share on flip ebook; *Multi-language book: add the languages you want to switchable; *Animation version of flip ebook: enable the feature of auto flipping. == Related wikiHows == * [[Adjust Flipping Speed in eFlip Standard|How to Adjust Flipping Speed in eFlip Standard]] * [[Change Page Size in eFlip Standard|How to Change Page Size in eFlip Standard]] * [[Create Page Flipping eBook with ZIP Format in eFlip Standard|How to Create Page Flipping eBook with ZIP Format in eFlip Standard]] * [[Create FBR Format of Flipbook to Read Offline with Eflip Professional|How to Create FBR Format of Flipbook to Read Offline with Eflip Professional]] *[[Insert Dynamic Text to Static PDF Page with Eflip Professional|How to Insert Dynamic Text to Static PDF Page with Eflip Professional]]

Do you find yourself squinting at the screen sometimes, and wish things were just "bigger?" Whether you have vision disabilities, or just like to zoom in for a close view of your screen, it's easy to do with just a couple keystrokes. This article will show you how to zoom in for a closeup of your browser or desktop. [[Category:Mac OS X]] == Steps == === Zooming in a Browser === # Launch a browser. Any browser will do: this method works the same on all!

[[Image:Update 1.png|center]] # Press Command and + (plus/equal button). Each repetition will increase the zoom by degrees. You can zoom in to varying degrees in different browsers:

[[Image:Update 2.png|center]] #* Up to 7x with Safari. #* Up to 8x with Chrome and Firefox. #* No limit with Opera, and each zoom is smaller than with other browsers. #* Pressing Command-0 will reset your zoom level in all browsers. #* Pressing Command-(minus) will zoom out in all browsers. === Zooming the Monitor === # Turn on Universal Access. From the Apple menu, select "Preferences." In the System Preferences pane, click on Universal Access.

[[Image:Zoom in on a Mac Step 1.png|center|550px]] # Click the Seeing button. In the Universal Access control panel, click the Seeing button to adjust the various visual controls of the interface.

[[Image:Zoom in on a Mac Step 2.png|center|550px]] # Set Zoom to On. In the Seeing control panel, locate and click the Zoom control button. You can also activate (and de-activate) zooming by pressing Command-option-8.

[[Image:Zoom in on a Mac Step 3.png|center|550px]] # Click "Options." Locate the "Options…" button to the right of the Zoom activation buttons. This will let you fine-tune your zooming controls.

[[Image:Zoom in on a Mac Step 4.png|center|550px]] #* Maximum Zoom: when you press the zoom-in keyboard shortcut (Command-option-equals), your screen will zoom to the magnification you set here. You can set the zoom anywhere from 1.1x the current screen size, to 20x the current screen size! #* Minimum Zoom: when you press the zoom-out keyboard shortcut (Command-option-minus), the screen will only zoom out to this preset level. #** In either case, continuing to hold down the keyboard shortcut will continue zooming in or out to the maximum levels. #* Show preview rectangle when zoomed out: To see what part of your screen will be magnified, enable this. It will show as a black rectangle on your screen. #* Smooth images: check this to add a smoothing function to the zoomed-in screen. While it improves the look of zoomed-in images, it can make text appear a little blurry. #* Zoom follows keyboard focus: when you are zoomed in, and type something that goes beyond the boundaries of the zoomed area, the screen will track your cursor so your text will always be displayed. #* Continuously with pointer: when zoomed in, the screen moves continuously as you move your cursor. #* Only when the pointer reaches an edge: your screen stays put until your cursor reaches the edge of the screen. #* So the pointer is at or near the center of the image: this keeps your cursor in the center of the screen, and only the screen moves. #* If your mouse features a scroll wheel, you can hold down the modifier keys and scroll. Rather than a quick zoom in and out to the preset maximum and minimum levels, using the scroll wheel provides a smooth, slow zoom in and back out. Set the modifier keys by clicking in the field, then pressing your preferred modifier keys. #* When you've finished setting the options, click the "Done" button. === Zooming in a Window === # Zoom in a window. Click this checkbox, and rather than zooming your entire screen, a "magnifying glass" enlarges everything underneath it. Like zooming the screen, you can adjust the level of zoom with Control-Option-Equals or Minus.

[[Image:Zoom in on a Mac Step 5.png|center|550px]] # Click on Options. Like regular zoom, zooming in a window has a set of options, as shown in the image below. #* Magnification: sets the zoom level when you activate Zoom in Window (Command-Option-8). #* Stationary: when the window position is set to "Stationary," the zoom window shows in the center of the monitor, and the cursor location determines what appears under the window. #* Follow mouse cursor: the window remains under your cursor, and can be dragged anywhere. This is similar to the way a real magnifying glass works. #* Tiled along edge: sets the zoom area to be a full-length column on the left side of your monitor, displaying zoomed content that tracks your cursor. #* Invert colors turns white to black, black to white, and green to purple. #* Smooth images: smoothes the edges of both text and images. #* Zoom follows keyboard focus: when you are zoomed in, and type something that goes beyond the boundaries of the zoom window, the cursor stays centered in the window while the magnified parts track your keyboard focus—usually your cursor or entry field. #* Enable temporary zoom: holding down Control-option keys will pop up a zoomed window that is active as long as you hold down the modifier keys. When you let go, the window disappears. #* Speak items under mouse after delay: will read whatever text is below your cursor. You can set the time delay from "Normal," which is instantaneous, to "Maximum," which is about five seconds. #* Enable "Use scroll wheel with modifier keys to zoom" to give mouse control to your zooming. To set the hot keys, press and hold the desired key or keys. Allowed keys are Shift, Control, Command, and Option, only. #* Adjust Size and Location: Press this button to resize and set the default position for whatever window you've chosen to display.Apple Help Center === View Option === # Go to the menu bar at the top of your computer screen. [[Image:Screen Shot 2014 02 23 at 1.57.40 PM.png|right|181px]] # Click Zoom in from the drop-down menu. [[Image:Screen Shot 2014 02 23 at 1.59.33 PM.png|right|181px]] #*Do this as many times as you need to get a bigger browser. == Tips == * Become familiar with the hot key combinations—even if you're not visually impaired, being able to zoom in on something quickly is a very handy feature, whether you just need a closeup, or are showing somebody something from across the room. == Related wikiHows == *[[Use Picture in Picture Zoom in Mac Os X Lion|How to Use Picture in Picture Zoom in Mac Os X Lion]] *[[Use Multi Touch Gestures in Mac Os X Lion| How to Use Multi Touch Gestures in Mac Os X Lion]] *[[Zoom In or Out on an iPhone or iPod Touch| How to Zoom In or Out on an iPhone or iPod Touch]] *[[Turn off Inertia Scrolling in Os X Lion|How to Turn off Inertia Scrolling in Os X Lion]] == Sources and Citations == {{reflist}} [[es:hacer un acercamiento en una Mac]] [[it:Zoomare con un Mac]] [[pt:Dar Zoom em um Mac]] [[zh:在Mac上放大]] [[de:Heranzoomen bei einem Mac]] __METHODS__ [[fr:zoomer sous Mac]] [[ru:пользоваться Zoom на Mac]]

[[Zoom Out on a PC|Zooming out]] and in on a PC is very simple. Here are several methods to do so! [[Category:Windows]] == Steps == ===In a Browser=== #In any browser, you can go to View >> Zoom In to magnify what's present on the screen.

{{whvid|Zoom in on a PC Step 1 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom in on a PC Step 1-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom in on a PC Step 1 Version 2.jpg}} ===Using the Mouse and Keyboard=== #Use the scroll wheel on your mouse. Press and hold the {{keypress|ctrl}} key; then scroll up with your mouse's scroll wheel or laptop's trackpad to zoom in.

{{whvid|Zoom in on a PC Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom in on a PC Step 2-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom in on a PC Step 2 Version 2.jpg}} #Alternatively, press and hold the {{keypress|ctrl}} key, then press {{keypress|+}} to zoom in.

{{whvid|Zoom in on a PC Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom in on a PC Step 3-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom in on a PC Step 3 Version 2.jpg}} #Return your zoom to default. Press {{keypress|ctrl}} and then the {{keypress|0}} (zero) key to return the screen to its original/normal magnification.

{{whvid|Zoom in on a PC Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom in on a PC Step 4-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom in on a PC Step 4 Version 2.jpg}} ===Using Magnifier=== #Open Magnifier. Windows PCs have an accessibility tool called Magnifier that you can hold over parts of the screen for readability and ease of usage. Launch the tool by going to Start → Programs → Accessories → Accessibility → Magnifier. Click on the magnifying glass icon to manage its settings or to turn it off.

{{whvid|Zoom in on a PC Step 5 Version 2.360p.mp4|Zoom in on a PC Step 5-preview Version 2.jpg|Zoom in on a PC Step 5 Version 2.jpg}} #*Setting Magnifier to "Full Screen" mode magnifies your entire screen. #*Setting Magnifier to "Lens" mode creates an magnified area that follows your mouse pointer, much like a real magnifying glass. #*You may also adjust the zoom level of your Magnifier. == Related wikiHows == *[[Zoom With a Web Browser|How to Zoom With a Web Browser]] *[[Zoom in on a Photo in Microsoft Paint|How to Zoom in on a Photo in Microsoft Paint]] *[[Zoom in Internet Explorer|How to Zoom in Internet Explorer]] *[[Make the Print Larger on a Computer Screen|How to Make the Print Larger on a Computer Screen]] *[[Zoom out in Adobe Illustrator|How to Zoom out in Adobe Illustrator]] == Sources and Citations == *[http://www.microsoft.com/athome/setup/magnify.aspx#fbid=FcEKLBoB_2I Magnify your computer screen: 6 ways to make it easier to see] [[es:acercar la vista en una PC]] [[it:Usare la Funzionalità Zoom Avanti su Computer]] [[pt:Dar Zoom no Computador]] [[de:Am PC heranzoomen]] [[zh:在个人电脑上放大画面]] [[ru:увеличить масштаб на компьютере]] [[fr:faire un zoom avant sur un ordinateur]]
